BeliefsTimeAloneOpen: For me, spending time alone depends quite a bit on the overall experience of the week or weeks, as well as the setting. After working at a job, for example, alone time when returning home feels like a great and positive experience allowing me to resume my hobbies and anything that interests me. But in other circumstances such as when in college but not really having people to do things with, being alone can become lonely. It can also become an overwhelming feeling of isolation, like there are people around but no one there. Over the summer months, I have experienced both the unpleasant feeling of being alone, because most of my friends are very far away, and the positive feeling of being alone that comes when I'm able to relax after work and enjoy myself.

I enjoy spending time alone and think of it as a positive experience, but it is important to not feel isolated. Even as a person who enjoys being alone and having limited interactions with people it is good to feel that you are coexisting with a social body, like being an introvert living in the city where it is hard to feel isolated but easy to keep to yourself

I enjoy spending time alone. I like my own company, and I am in complete control of the activities I do and what actions I take next. I can listen to music without speaking. If I wish to socialize, I can do so by reaching out through my phone. I can get lost in my imagination and mind (this is good but sometimes is detrimental). If I spend too much time alone, I find it difficult to remember how to interact with people, as if i’ve fallen out of practice. Sometimes, being alone with intense negative emotions makes it overwhelming to contain or cope with them, and this can lead to further isolation or embarrassment of how I acted (which also leads to withdrawing). Then, it’s a vicious cycle. Otherwise, being alone is what I prefer, and it gives me the energy I need to socially interact.
I definitely want alone time. It's almost essential to me. I interact with people all day and need to decompress. I feel like I recharge when I can self focus.
I enjoy spending time alone sometimes. I think it is a good way to decompress and relieve stress.

I am right in the middle. I like being alone to recharge. To re-think something on my mind. To do the hobbies I like to do, but no one else does.

But I like being with people 50% of the time. To have fun. To talk. To validate each other.

Spending time alone is a very positive and preferred experience (especially for a reader).  I do like spending time with others, but in small doses and for limited periods of time.  My partner and I both traveled on business a lot and he maintained two other homes in states where he did a lot of business.  We probably spent about 7 days a month together.  It was perfect.

Generally speaking, I do not have a lot of time alone. I am a husband and father of 4 children. Every so often I have time alone and it is generally a positive experience. I had some yesterday and I used it to clean up and also listen to a podcast. Then I watched some television and cooked myself dinner. It was enjoyable to me and a positive experience. I remember when I did not have a wife or children, and in general my time alone was positive then, but I also spent lots of time with friends.

I haven’t always been alone, but after the death of my husband 6 years ago I have been alone a large majority of the time. Several of my closest friends have passed away too and that only made my situation worse. I feel that people need time away from others in order to fully understand who you are, what you want from your life, and how you truly feel about the world around you and the people living in it that you encounter. You have to know yourself before you can begin to understand others.

I think time alone can be both positive and negative.  There are times when we all need time alone, to unwind and destress.  Sometimes we need to be alone.  I have certainly experienced times where I wanted to and needed to be alone to just rest, unwind and destress.  Other times being alone can feel lonely for sure.  When those times arise, it can certainly feel like a negative experience.

Spending time alone can be positive if it's in moderation. When you spend time alone you can focus on yourself and have your thoughts yourself. You can relax and spend the day how you want. When I spend time alone I can think about life and enjoy some of my hobbies. Some negatives of spending too much time alone are loneliness and being disconnected to the outside world. A negative experience is that I could become depressed not seeing people. After a busy week, I like spending time alone but I wouldn't want to be alone every weekend.
I find it to be positive and enjoyable. It allows me to organize my thoughts and I can pursue whatever I want.

I am a weird person, self admittedly, and like since i was a child ive always loved being alone, and also talking to myself. When i am alone i feel like i can relax, and be myself fully, im a little obsessed with my own alone free time which is pretty lame, i need to work on my socializing and comunications. but for me spending time alone is amazing i need lots of it
Spending time alone can give you the opportunity to connect with your yourself. so it can also allow you to feel relaxed and take care of the things that you really enjoy.

Spending time alone can be a positive experience for me. I have no one to answer to. I can do what I what, when I want. I can watch or listen to whatever I want. I am able to focus on my own thoughts and desires. I can wear (or not wear) whatever I feel like. 
I feel that being alone can help in my creativity as I am not influenced by any outside sources. I am able to get lost in my thoughts or meditate. Being lost in my thoughts can greatly influence my actions throughout the day. It helps me plan for the immediate and sometimes far reaching future. It helps me create lists and often helps me remember things I've needed going forward especially getting things for my apartment. 
As I write this I am finding that there are far more advantages to being alone that I previously realized.

I believe spending time alone can be a positive and negative experience depending on the situation. Spending too much time alone becomes a negative experience for me, the side of the spectrum is spending no time alone, I need a little time to recharge my batteries. It's about finding that perfect balance in my opinion.

For me personally, I find time spent alone to be a very positive experience.  I usually find that when others are present, I have to exert energy simply "being on" around them, requiring a heightened degree of awareness and presence in a way that isn't required when I'm alone.  Being alone is also quieter - both in the literal sense, but also in the more broad sense of there being less distractions when others are round.  So, in short, I find time spent alone to be refreshing, focused and all around pleasant.

I am alone a lot. I don't need people around to entertain me. I like things quiet. I don't even need the TV on or music. I sometimes get lonely and wish I had someone special in my life to do things with. Sometimes I go somewhere alone. I often go to a restaurant alone. Sometimes I feel odd about that. Sometimes I get bored and have no one to hang with but I don't feel lonely much. I talk on the phone and facetime my adult children. I have hobbies. I have my cats. I rarely see being alone as negative. Often I am alone by choice. I can't be bothered with other peoples issues. I don't want to entertain other people .

I spend most of my time alone. I find it very peaceful. I have my dog for company and the community cats that I take care of. 
I do have a part-time job and enjoy the social interaction with my co-workers but by the end of my shift, I am ready to go home. I need my down time. I do wish I had a few friends and the money to go out occasionally. That would be fun.

Giving yourself alone time means you can explore these things without the pressures and judgments that others may impose. Having time to yourself is critical for growth and personal development. Instead of worrying about the needs, interests, and opinions that others may have, alone time lets you focus on yourself.

Also at the end of the day, you only have yourself

For the most part spending time alone is positive for me. I enjoy time without feeling pressures of social interaction or feeling like I need to cater myself to other people. I do think that complete isolation is a negative for me though and that I do need periodic closeness with other people in order to maintain a healthy mindset.

I value my time alone very, very dearly. As an introverted-extrovert, I enjoy spending time with people but at a certain point I always need to take time to myself to recharge my batteries. I think such things are valuable for everybody, even the most extroverted party animals. Time alone allows you to think about important things without distraction, to rest your brain and recover from your ordeals.

Spending time alone can be both a re-energizing experience and lonely. I definitely require an amount of social and alone time. I am an introvert. I used to be an ambivert on the more extroverted side. I work with people as a therapist in my job so I feel like I require more alone time and that alone time I need is solitude for me. Sometimes if I am alone for too long I lose the momentum of socializing and there are times I will get bored or lonely when I have too much time alone. These days I feel more content when i'm alone. In a way im less alone now because I am married and have a needy pet and even then I enjoy my alone time away from them. 
The pandemic was very lonely for me and I was depressed. Now that there are no more restrictions, it did make me more of an introvert so my tolerance around energy and people is different.

Spending time alone is necessary to get to know yourself. I am an extrovert and love meeting new people, spending time with my loved ones, and having a busy social calendar.

Aside from how busy my life is, I cherish the time I get to spend alone, doing what I want to do. This may involve taking a day off from any plans to make a nice meal, catching up on tv shows I haven't had the chance to watch, taking a bath, painting, or running errands.

Time spent alone is almost always a positive experience for me. There have been times where I was going through really distressing periods in my life. I spent a lot of time alone in those instances and they weren't my favorite. However, it was during those times I was able to process grief and really reflect about the things I want in my life.

Since I am the person I'm spending the most time with, I want to make sure that I enjoy the time that I do get to spend with myself, doing things that I like doing, and learning more about these things too.

I mostly really enjoy time alone. When I am alone I can choose how long to do each activity I enjoy without concern for others preferences. I also find I tend to get through to-do lists much more when I'm alone. I can prioritize myself over others without any guilt. 

However when I spend too much time alone I find a negative in lack of feeling connected to others. Sometimes I work from home for days at a time alone and miss in person human connection.

I enjoy time alone to play games, surveys, exercise, watch tv, and read.  I live alone and am retired so most my time is spent alone so I think I need to get out more.  Too much time alone is hard on your mental health.

I think spending time alone can be a positive experience when you are used to being around people often. If you spend too much time alone, it becomes more of a negative experience but you start to feel social withdrawal.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me. I like to think deeply about many things and being alone gives me the opportunity to do so. I also find being alone especially in a remote aria to be a very pleasant and peaceful experience.

As I get older, I've come to think of being alone as a more positive thing. Being alone has given me the opportunity to spend time on myself and developing personal hobbies and talents. I used to waste a lot of time feeling lonely and seeking superficial interactions, but now I spend most of my time alone studying and working on personal improvement. I still get lonely sometimes so being alone is sometimes negative for me too.
I love spending time alone because I can have as engaging or boring a day as I like without feeling responsible for another person's happiness.

I prefer to be alone so that's how I spend the majority of my days. I think it's good to spend time alone because you can dig deep and discover some things about yourself. I think it's good to have social interactions and try to balance out alone time with social time but ultimately each person is different so social needs are very diverse. Some people prefer to be a lot more social and I also think that's perfectly fine but for me, I find that I'm less stressed out in the comfort of my own self.
I find spending time alone to be a very postive experience.  I have never been a social person to begin with.  When I am alone, I can think more clearly and work harder than with other people.

i don't mind being alone for most of the time. i get to play the game i want. not having  to help someone everything i play with them or so. but i do think it more negative at time because of the fact i do like sometime with friend and stuff and hate being alone. it never really a great being alone all the time and what not since you wont be able to let out your feel or so or having fun memory etc

I think spending time alone is a primarily positive experience for me because I think it is a good time to do things that are better done when alone such as reflection or planning something out. Also, it is good in my opinion to spend some time alone because it is important for you to understand yourself better so then you can express yourself freely.

For many people, spending time alone can be both a positive and negative experience, depending on various factors such as personality, circumstances, and personal preferences. Here are some reasons why being alone might be perceived as positive or negative:

Positive Aspects of Being Alone:

Self-reflection: Alone time allows individuals to engage in self-reflection, introspection, and better understanding of their thoughts and emotions.
Recharge: It can serve as a way to recharge and regain energy after social interactions or stressful situations.
Autonomy: Being alone provides a sense of independence and freedom to pursue personal interests without external influence.
Creativity: Many people find that they are more creative and productive when they have uninterrupted alone time to focus on tasks or hobbies.
Solitude: Some individuals simply enjoy the peace and tranquility that solitude brings, allowing them to find a sense of inner peace.
Negative Aspects of Being Alone:

Loneliness: Spending extended periods alone can lead to feelings of loneliness and isolation, which can negatively impact mental health.
Lack of Support: During challenging times, being alone may mean lacking the emotional and social support that one might need.
Overthinking: For some, solitude can lead to overthinking or rumination, which might result in negative thought patterns.
Boredom: Without external stimuli or social interactions, some individuals may find themselves feeling bored or unengaged.
Missing Out: Being alone might lead to feelings of missing out on social experiences and opportunities for connection.
It's important to note that the perception of spending time alone can vary significantly from person to person. Some individuals are naturally more introverted and find solace in solitude, while others are extroverted and thrive in social settings. Additionally, the context and duration of being alone can influence how one perceives the experience. Overall, the balance between alone time and social interactions can be essential for maintaining overall well-being and mental health.
I appreciate the time to gather my thoughts and reflect on my life. I can do it anywhere, whether in my garden, on a hike, while on a flight, or as I watch tv, so it's quite convenient.

I enjoy being alone for the most part. I'm kinda used to it. I will say though that I don't like to spend multiple days alone. It's great to have time alone to reflect and think about things on your mind. But spending too much time alone can make me feel extremely lonely and think about problems rather than relaxing.
spending time alone is great for i love to be alone to think or to play video games
Spending time alone is a positive experience because it helps me recharge. It can become a negative experience when I get bored

I think spending time alone is a positive experience because it can help you emotionally and mentally recharge after being around people. I think when you are constantly out and around people you tend to put on a fake persona. to combat this time alone is necessary in order to be mentally comfortable and to get back in touch with ones true self.

I think a good amount of alone time is a positive thing! I spend time alone often, sometimes on purpose, sometimes not. I work a lot which enjoy but it doesn't leave me with a lot of time to socialize and sometimes I'm just not in the mood to socialize. I enjoy spending alone time to have a peaceful evening and be alone with my thoughts. I'm able to contemplate my goals, week ahead, feelings and think about life. I feel like I'm the most productive when I have alone time. Too much alone time can be negative because I've noticed after having too much alone time, I start to feel lonely.

I love to spend time by myself.  I don't like to be alone for weeks on end, but it is really pleasant for me to do some yoga, listen to some chill music or read a book.  Often, I make plans of what I want to accomplish and that is really helpful.  I don't like the idea of being alone with nothing to do.  
My favorite period of time when I enjoyed alone time was over a period of 8 month, this year, I wrote an emotional will, then I formatted it into a chapter book to give to my kids.  It is full of highlights, dark times, and what I believe is important.  This was really a self-nurturing exercise.  
I like people, but I really only like to be out with my people, not just wasting time acting like I am a socialite.  There is a full time loneliness and emptiness in just surrounding myself with the general public.  
When I am with people who are really good fits to my personality, I do love spending time with them.  
Just not every day.
I like spending time alone, because it's when I can recharge and be myself without any interruptions. It is positive for me, because I can think out loud and do whatever I want to do.

In my opinion, spending time alone is a positive experience. I enjoy the time to unwind after a day of work. I do think there is a thing as too much alone time, and a balance is needed, whether it be with a friend or significant other. Alone time is also important in relationships.

I think being alone is a positive experience for me and everyone should try it from time to time. I find that I like more alone time than others but it is good for me to recharge and do things that I enjoy on my own time with my own thoughts.
Time alone is a positive experience for myself personally because it helps me to clear my head of any negative energy, stress, and heaviness from the day.

I think that spending time alone is generally a very positive experience. It allows me to fully relax and think in a peaceful environment, and I find it is the only way I can fully recharge my energy. However, I also think too much time alone can be negative because of a tendency to get stuck in thought loops.
I enjoy being alone. I find after spending time with people I need time alone to recharge. I need quiet to think and process events.

My time alone is a positive experience and much needed.  During this time, I work on housework, yard work, talk to friends on Facebook or on the phone, and shop or take care of me.  Having this time energizes me and I have more to give to others.  Since my daughter and husband also accumulate too many things, this gives me time to clear clutter and makes me happy.

I think we can get our thoughts so cluttered when we're focused on others. It takes alone time to sit and process what we're thinking. I don't think we can really process our experiences and emotions well without isolated reflection.

I enjoy being alone because it is exhausting giving a rat's ass about some else feelings and needs. On the flip side, I do miss having someone around, with whom I connect with, but not enough to not be alone. In a nutshell, I like being alone than not being alone but would not mind being with someone, someday.
I love spending time alone, I think it can be incredibly rejuvenating if the conditions are right - if it's a positive environment meant for personal growth.

Spending time alone can be positive or negative for me depending on the context. For example, if I've had a bad day at work and maybe disagreements, I may want to be left alone for a little bit. But if I am feeling good I want to be social. If I feel good and want to have a party but no one wants to come, that is hurtful.

I think doing things alone is neutral. Sometimes it's hard to be alone when you don't want to be, or to be alone when you don't feel like doing the activity/chore you need to do. At the same time being alone gives you the freedom to do whatever you want

I typically think of being alone as a positive experience. I am an introvert and also shy, so oftentimes I find being around people for extended periods of time to be draining and anxiety-inducing. When I'm alone I feel far more relaxed because I am not worried that I need to act or look a certain way to be "normal" or entertaining to the people around me. I like being alone because I don't have to consider anyone else's needs or wants when I'm deciding what to do or where to go. Traveling alone can sometimes be awkward or lonely, but overall I enjoy going places by myself because I can go at my own pace and do everything I'm interested in on my schedule. I would say that 80% of the time I am very happy being alone and independent. The only times I don't enjoy it is when I've not had any meaningful contact with family and friends for a while, and I start to feel lonely.

Spending time alone is usually a positive experience for me. I like having time to myself to be creative and write and draw. Sometimes spending time alone causes me to sleep too much or overthink worries and recent events.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me.  It gives me a chance to recharge without having to take anyone else into consideration.  I don't have to be "on".  I can simply do what I want, when I want, and only be responsible for myself in that time.

I think being alone is a positive experience. You get to really know yourself, tend to yourself and practice self care. For me, it is a positive experience because I get to reset my mind and body. I can take time to recharge and set intentions, pray and get myself prepared for what’s ahead. Being alone allows for me to remain in balance and can be an enriching experience and allows me to understand my wants, needs, and care for myself. I enjoy my alone time and yearn for it often. So overall, I think it is a very positive experience to have alone time to take care of your emotional and physical needs as well as checking of things that are a priority to you and only you!

It really does depend on your mindset.  I think it takes more effort, atleast for me, to think positive in those alone times.  If I'm positive, I can use my alone time to be more productive and creative and really enjoy things I love.  If I'm negative, I'll be alot less productive and make myself anxious and all the bad stuff will look huge.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me. I am an introvert. I enjoy the time I have to myself to do what I like. I love using my computer to browse websites or blogs. I also like reading. When I have enough alone time, I'm also able to draw or paint.

As I have gotten older, I really enjoy spending time alone.  I find it relaxing to be able to do what I want and not have to worry about entertaining another person.  However, when I was younger, I hated to be alone and always wanted to be around people.  It's strange how my feelings have changed.  I honestly could be alone all the time if I had to, it wouldn't bother me.
i think it is a positive thing to have spend time alone with yourself. If you are not comfortable being alone with yourself then it will be very hard to have a good social life

It is positive for me because I have social anxiety and it can be very stressful being around people all the time. With being alone, I can do the things I want and when I want without worrying about other people or feeling bad that we aren't doing exactly what the other person wants to do

I feel that being alone is good for me. All expectations are gone, only my thoughts to explore. I really enjoy my alone time, as long as it is combined with time with my family and friends. When I'm alone I listen to music, read, garden, play with my cat, take a walk, and other things I enjoy. I feel totally at ease and relaxed in my alone time.

I grew up as an only child, so I feel like I’m used to doing things at home alone and I know how to prioritize my time. For me, I’ve always found being alone to be a positive experience and it allows me to recharge, and I can do things I’m more comfortable doing when I’m alone.

For me time spent alone while doing an activity, like running is very good and lets me connect with myself and process things but if I am inactive and alone I tend to become lonely and miss human connection.

I actually don't spend any time truly alone.  My husband is by my side 99% of the time, but we often are doing separate tasks independently.  I think for the most part being totally and completely alone would be unbearable for me, but silence doesn't bother me as much as it might some people.

I find time alone to be a mixture of good and bad experiences. One negative aspect of it is that I realize that few people have expressed interest in being around me, and I wonder if I have been failing to meet some sort of realistic expectations which haven't been spelled out.

One positive aspect of time alone is that when I prefer to decide what I see and hear (as much as I practically can), I can nearly or fully accomplish that goal by being alone.

I am an introvert and spending time alone helps to re-energize me. Too much time by myself can make me feel lonely so a healthy balance is best for me. I love to spend time at home and listen to music, read, and do crafts and then another night, I'll enjoy going out and seeing a lot of people.

Generally I find time alone to be a positive experience up to a point.  I enjoy peace and quiet and the ability to make choices without having to take others into account.  But if I were alone too much I would be lonely and bored.

I think being alone is a key to a healthy self-concept.  Although I am extroverted and feel that my cup is filled by being with others, I know it is crucial to spend time alone and not require the presence of others.  I think people who can't be alone are at risk of becoming co-dependent in relationships.  Being alone is a positive experience for me, because I am an only child.

I enjoy spending time alone. I use alone time to get ahead on different projects. I generally find this time as a positive for me. I can either read or write without distractions. I can do different side hustles on my alone time.

Time alone for me is important not only to reflect but to just be away from others. I generally dislike the public and dealing with people and find peace in being alone most of the time. I get a sense of well being by myself and its phenomenal.

I enjoy spending time alone, in fact, there could be times where i spend whole weeks alone and ive been fine. for me, its a positive experience, and while there may be some negative drawbacks if you are left with 0 contact, there are benefits that outweigh it (at least for me). I live with someone so even if i wanted to its harder to get time on my own but it is a nice experience.

Being alone, or alone time, is extremely positive for me. In fact, for me personally, it’s absolutely essential. I’m not someone who is anti-social necessarily, but I am completely fine with being alone and doing my own thing. I go to movies alone. I’ve gone to concerts alone, whatever. I don’t find that weird, I’m just comfortable with myself and ok being alone. 

Conversely, I do love sharing experiences with loved ones too, of course. But to be able to retire to my space and be alone, decompress, is positive and needed.

I find spending a moderate amount of time alone to be fun and freeing. It can be a very positive experience. I love being able to decide where I go, what I eat, and what time I do things. After a longer period however, this can become more negative, as I get kind of lonely. Alone time can be peaceful and nice, but too much of it becomes depressing. I like having people to bounce ideas off of, and I find when I am alone for more than a few hours I start reaching out to people and making phone calls.

I think, overall, that spending time alone is a positive experience for me. It allows me to do things with less anxiety-- I don't fixate on how the other person is doing, if they're enjoying themselves enough, etc. But I also recognize that sort of anxiety isn't healthy, and that I've had plenty of good times not doing things alone. And I do crave being social and doing things with others! So I guess being time alone also works in a good way to remind myself that I am human and want normal human relationships.

As an introvert, I gain energy from being alone. I don't like being around a lot of people. The experience is often too noisy and there are too many different sensations to manage. I also understand that self-isolating can be unhealthy. 
There is a sort of safety in self-isolating. If you're alone no one can hurt you but I also understand that that can lead to worsened mental health and stuff like that. In conclusion, being alone can be healthy as long as you don't self-isolate.

I love being alone. Really, it is one of my favorite times. I consider myself an introvert and find peace / tranquility being alone. I typically play a solo video game, read social media, or look up topics I am passionate about. Recently, I have been looking for Funko Pops or halloween props. Random things I get passionate about all from my alone time.

I don't like being alone, I've been marired and had 3 children. I've been needed for a long time , and I've helped raise my grandchildren and now I don't know how to not be needed. Time alone to me is how we older people feel ALONE. This is a negative experience.

I spend 90% of my days at home alone and I personally find it to be a pleasant experience. I have plenty of time to do whatever I want from listening to music, reading, watching videos, doing work, etc. without anyone interrupting me and having to do something else. I can get a lot done with no distractions.

I like to spend time by myself. As an introvert, being around people or social areas really drains me, so I recharge when I'm alone. I don't have to be anxious about how I'm being perceived, so I can just be my regular, most comfortable version of myself. It's also good because you can do whatever you want without upsetting or disappointing anyone. You choose the food, the music, whatever, and nobody can complain because there isn't anyone there *to* complain. It's a freeing, relaxing thing to be by yourself.
To me spending time alone is a positive experience because it gives me time to relax and have some quiet time to myself.

Spending time alone is a positive for me. It gives me a chance to unwind and work on different hobbies or get chores done without someone interrupting me. I can daydream, or just think to myself without interruption.

Spending time alone is a genuinely transformative and enriching experience that has a remarkably positive impact on my life. To a significant extent, I believe that embracing solitude is an essential aspect of personal growth and self-discovery. The benefits of this practice are manifold, and they resonate deeply with me for several reasons.

First and foremost, solitude provides an invaluable opportunity for introspection and self-awareness. It allows me to delve into the depths of my thoughts and emotions without the distractions of external influences. In this sacred space of quiet contemplation, I gain a clearer understanding of my values, aspirations, and fears, enabling me to chart a more authentic and fulfilling path in life.

Moreover, solitude empowers me to cultivate a profound sense of independence and self-reliance. Embracing moments of solitude nurtures the ability to trust my instincts and judgment, fostering a stronger connection with my inner voice and intuition. This newfound self-assurance propels me to tackle challenges with resilience and creativity, making me more adaptable in various situations.

Furthermore, alone time is a refuge of peace and tranquility amidst the hustle and bustle of modern life. The world can often be overwhelming, constantly stimulating, and demanding. Taking solitude as a respite enables me to recharge my energies, replenish my soul, and rediscover a deep sense of serenity.
I find spending time alone to be an enjoyable, positive experience. It's a great way for me to recharge and I feel refreshed afterwards.

I believe that everyone should spend an ample amount of time alone. You learn to be self-sustaining whether it be cooking, cleaning, or contemplating your life and future. You learn to love, respect and value yourself. I feel you can never love another until you truly love yourself. It can be positive and uplifting to enjoy your own company. You become grateful and appreciate the time spent with others and put more value on your time together.

I think spending time alone is a positive experience for me. I like to focus and do a narrow range of activities at maximum engagement, and this is not possible when around other people. I don't think it's possible to fully relax unless by myself.
I think spending time away is a positive experience most of the time. It allows me to get breathing room and focus on my responsibilities, as well as enjoy activities that are best enjoyed solo

I value time alone because I am married with a child. Having time alone is not common and I enjoy my solitude because it allows me to be free to do what I want without worrying about how it impacts anyone else. I enjoy having this time to myself to reflect, enjoy a game or music in solitude to recharge and relax. I am an introverted person, so I often do not feel energized by being around others. I refill my batteries when I can have some peaceful alone time.
I am an introvert and enjoy time alone. It is a positive experience for me and helps me to recharge both my mental and emotional states.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me because I am an introvert and can get tired after spending a lot of time with people and in social group settings. I like being with my friends and family, but I do like to have time for myself to recenter myself and gain energy again to hang out with people again. I do think spending too much time alone can become a negative experience, especially if my anxiety starts to take a hold of me and I spiral into negative thoughts.

I've been working from home for about three years now. At first, I found it a really uplifting and fulfilling experience, as I had worked in a crowded office setting with a lot of interaction my entire life up to that point. Now though--after a few years--it's getting harder; harder for me to stay motivated and harder for me to concentrate on work.

Personally for me, time alone is a very positive experience because I absolutely enjoy spending most of my time alone. I am someone who does not like a crowd (or noise) around me. I love my peace and quiet. When I am alone I get to meditate, pray, cook, do lots of creative things and work on my computer. Socially, when I am with people I also enjoy good intelligent conversation(s), but I find my time spent alone to be more worthwhile and enjoyable to me.

Spending time along is a very positive experience for me.  I get to unwind and relax.  I don't have to be "on" and entertain someone.  I can enjoy myself without judgement.  I also get to think a lot and explore while I am by myself.

Being alone is a positive thing for me sometimes. When I travel I like seeing things that others might find boring so that alone time allows me to explore and enjoy on my own. In the evenings I have alone time allowing me to read my books and be immersed in what I am learning. However, I would not want to be alone all the time and want to feel loved and care for as well

I think that spending time alone is a positive experience. It's an opportunity to get in tune with your body, how you're feeling, reflect on the day, and the like. It's also your best opportunity for personal growth and goal setting. This, however, does not mean that one can neglect their social relationships.

Spending time alone is a very positive experience for me. I am not a people person and do not like people. I enjoy peace and quiet and most people bring chaos and destruction. And, they are just plain loud and annoying. I like to surround myself with a small group of people that are not needy and they do their own work quietly or play quietly. When they are away, I like to relax quietly and watch a movie or do research on historical figures. This is exciting for me and I do not want a bunch of loud people distracting me from that.

I feel like it’s a positive thing for me because then I can do things that I want and watch shows that I like, like anime or K-dramas.  Also, it gives me time to be able to concentrate on important things like surveys.

Spending time alone is a positive experience because it helps for me to take a break from the day, gather my thoughts, and take a breather. I believe that it centers me and it helps me to regain focus on tasks and to dos.
As I've gotten older it's gotten to be more and more of a negative. As the weight of life presses down and the realization that the loneliness will only get more common until the end.

I think it is positive since it gives you time to relax and unwind. It gives you some quiet time and a chance to think for yourself. I enjoy having alone time to do what I want and spend time on myself without having to worry about other people.
I'm a pretty introverted person and am pretty comfortable with myself, I can entertain myself pretty easily but there are times where I do get lonely and I gain a desire to return to my friends.
It can be a positive experience when life is hectic. Spending time alone gives you time to think and relax.

Being alone is more like a negative experience to me mainly because it is a very lonely experience being alone. I'm an individual who enjoys other peoples company, it gives me more security being with someone else. Going out with someone else helps enrich the outing and it is more fun
Spending time alone can have both positive and negative aspects, and the extent to which it is viewed as positive or negative can vary from person to person.
its's a positive thing for me. It allows me time to think and relax in have peace and quite

Most definitely positive. I have enjoyed being alone for all of my 70 years. I am an extreme introvert. Of course you still need to be social with people for your well being. But I need and want alone time every day. It gives me time to think. To plan. Action/reflection.

Spending time alone usually for me is a pleasant situation.  Being alone gives me the chance to meditate thoughtfully about various elements in my daily life... and it gives me time to read and write, which I very much enjoy doing.

Spending time alone for a certain period of time is good for me, because it allows me to do things I enjoy (gaming, journaling, reading). It also gives me time to think. However, if I spend too much time alone, I will overthink and this has a negative impact on me usually. Typically, spending a week alone is the maximum for me. Any longer than that, and it starts to impact my mental health.

I think being alone is positive when you have the right mindset. Being alone gives you space and opportunity to be yourself and find your internal pains and honest feelings. Being alone when you are scared or anxious or feeling lonely makes things worse by feeding into thinking.

I spend most of my time alone but have enough to do or think about to make it a positive situation. Especially in my spiritual studies and readings I find the most enjoyment. I do hope someone will call and want to go somewhere and do something to relieve the alone time. I do try to think positively about the situation that I am facing.

I am someone who very much values my alone time. I find my time around people to be taxing and impactful on my energy. I am a people pleaser and will do whatever I can to make every encounter a positive experience. So that means I usually need a lot of time to "recover". I also suffer from anxiety and depression, which can make me cranky and irritable. I would rather be alone than to subject others to my crabbiness. 

That being said, I do get in bad phases of near complete isolation that isn't healthy. It makes me rusty in social situations which makes my anxiety worse and then it is all downhill. The more socialization is normalized, the better I feel. But at the end of the say I will always require a bit of alone time!

I enjoy spending time alone, but I also enjoy spending time with my friends and my family. Sometimes I feel like I am overstimulated when other people around so having my own space for a couple or 3 hours feels very peaceful. I also have hobbies then I enjoy being able to concentrate on when I'm by myself. Especially painting. I suppose sometimes I can spend too much time alone and begin to feel lonely since I have few friends in town nowadays. To see a close friend I need to go visit them in another city or they need to be coming to my town.  So I can sometimes go many weeks without seeing one of my closer friends.

Self-Reflection: Alone time provides an opportunity for introspection and self-discovery. It allows individuals to explore their thoughts, emotions, and values without external influences.
Recharging: For introverted individuals, being alone can be energizing and restorative. It provides a chance to recharge their mental and emotional batteries after social interactions.
Freedom and Independence: Alone time allows individuals to pursue their interests and activities without the constraints of others' schedules or preferences. It fosters a sense of independence and self-reliance.

I think spending time alone is a positive experience because one can use this time in order to reflect on their own life as well as recharge their own "social battery" so to speak. Everyone can benefit from alone time in this way. However, there is an extent to where there is too much alone time. All people need alone time but they also equally require social time. Both need to kept in balance for a healthy lifestyle.
I think spending time alone is usually a positive experience. It allows me time to decompress and time to think more clearly about things. However, I start to dislike it when I start becoming bored.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me because it lets me have some time to recharge and get back in tune with myself. I find that spending time alone lets me recenter myself and stop and think about where I am mentally and gives me time to fully relax and just be myself. I've grown to appreciate spending time alone because it's been useful in organizing myself and my thoughts.

I prefer to be alone and only socialize with a very small group of people. I don't like crowds or large groups. Being alone, as long as I have a book or can use my computer, just lets me unwind and relax in ways that I can't do when I'm stuck being around other people all the time. In the modern age, there are so many ways to be alone, yet still be social as well, so I think people might not feel as alone if they have some sort of online community, either on social media or video games, etc.

There are times that I enjoy being alone. In doing so, I am able to get work done, watch a few movies, play around on my social media account, or even take a short nap. Alone time is definitely a positive experience for me. The thing about being alone is that it's my option to do so. My alone time is best after work, in the late evenings and at times, the weekend.

I've experienced both positive and negative thoughts while being alone. I feel like in the beginning I had a harder time being alone because I was processing the information wrong. I thought of it as no one wants to be around me rather than finding a moment to enjoy the silence. Now i love being alone and it really allows myself to get things done and reflect on myself.
I think spending time alone is a good experience. I get to think out my own thoughts without people bothering me or influencing my thoughts. It gives me a clearer logic and mental development.
I think it can be both. SOmetimes I need to be around other people. Sometimes I need alone time. Either situation can be negative.

I think being alone sometimes is a good thing.  In the times where I am alone I like to clear my mind and sit with my thoughts.  It allows me to reflect on the previous days and sometimes it feels okay not to talk for a day.  I think that its okay to want to be alone for a little while but then it can lead to you getting used to being alone and not wanting to socialize and be around other people.  It can prevent you from even wanting to leave your house sometimes.  So as much as I think its okay to be alone, you should try to balance it.

Time alone is both a necessity and a burden on me. As someone who lives alone and doesn't have many in-person friends or an intimate partner, I find myself feeling isolated and longing for connection. As an introvert, I also find that I have a limited capacity for interacting with others and need to unwind and recharge after draining my social battery. I do crave and need some alone time, but at the moment, I have too much of it and it's not a healthy balance.

spending time alone is a positive experience for me. i am an introspective person, so being alone is natural for me, and i am able to meditate on my thoughts. however, i feel like i take it to the extreme - i spend way too much time alone. for example, i can go without contacting anyone, including text, for over a week. i am fine just surfing the web or cooking a meal for extended periods of time without any social contact

Being alone is a positive experience for me. I find that I don't have to monitor what I say and what I do as much. I can move about on my own schedule and go wherever I want. I don't have to constantly be thinking about the other person and their comfort level of what's going on in the moment. I can just be me and worry about me. One of my favorite things to do alone is go to the movies. I hate when people talk during a movie especially in a movie theater so it makes sense. But more than that, going to the movies is a peaceful and meaningful activity for me. It pulls me out of my head and I don't feel so lonely.

As someone who considers themselves a "cerebral" person I find time by myself pleasant, relaxing, refreshing, reflective, and necessary to provide a space for introspection and an opportunity to reset.
I prefer to be alone I have spent most of my life this way. I tend to be self contained and do not depend on anyone.

It's positive. I am a bit of an introvert and I enjoy doing a lot of solitary activities and hobbies. It seems to take more energy for me to be social, at times. I always have something to do and I am rarely bored.
I need time alone to recharge, as I am a pretty heavy introvert. However, when I want company and can't find it, I can fall into depression pretty easily.

Spending time alone for me is a very positive experience. With the daily stresses of life, I find myself needing to be alone in order to recharge. If I do not have this time to myself, I could see myself becoming burnt out and losing a bit of myself.
highly positive, being alone is condudive to reflection and self-awareness leading to deeper insights about oneself and the world

I mostly spend time by myself or just my kid and I. I think it can be a positive experience and a negative. Being able to sort of unplug from people can be very stress relieving. But overly long stretches of being alone can take it's toll on some people. Humans are social creatures and need interaction from others for the most part.

I think spending time alone is a positive experience for me. It is positive for me because usually when I am around friends I am influenced by peer pressure. Another positive for me spending time alone, is that I can get a lot more work done and not be distracted. The only negative for spending time alone,  is that I do sometimes miss company and live interaction with people.
For me, being alone is a positive experience. I get nervous and do not feel at ease when I'm around others. Being alone allows me to feel comfortable and to decompress.
I think we need to understand ourselves in order to be good members of society. Thus, to some extent, I think alone time is necessary.

Time alone is often recharging time for me because I am sensitive to sensory input- I experience sensory overload easily/often. Being alone allows me to control the sensory input in my environment in a way that I can mitigate/recover from sensory overload. However, when left on my own for extended periods of time, my thoughts begin to spiral and I feel restless. While it is important for me to have a few hours of alone time every day, my best estimate is that I also need at least an hour of interaction to feel my best.
Time alone allows me to process my thoughts and how the world and I intersect.
I love spending time alone. I can do whatever I want without objection.

I've spent many many years alone or with a pet, in which I prefer rather than with people, I have a little social anxiety. I have always preferred to be alone, being with people all the time just makes me overthink things, with family not so much because they know me well and enjoy talking to me, but if I had a real choice to be with someone like married people I'd prefer to live in a cave on a mountain and never see people ever again, I live in an apartment building with 30 other people and I would give anything to find a nice little house on a nice quiet street. Being alone gives me inner peace of mind, the very thing I only care about.

I enjoy being alone as I can go about my chores, tasks, etc at my own pace withoutout distractions. This doesn't mean I am always wanting to be alone. It just means I appreciate being alone at my choice.

I think spending time alone is a positive experience. It helps me to unwind and relax. It also recharges my social battery. I can also be quite productive when I'm alone. Of course, there's a limit, and I get lonely after a certain point, but in general, I appreciate the alone time I have.
spending time alone is a positive experience for me as I can focus on activities focused on my personal development and relaxation.

Im heavy on this topic . I find spending time alone to be essential to living a positive lifestyle . Atleast for people similiar to my personality and traits . I truly feel in everyday life i need a certain amount of alone time to be able to cope and think about things properly and reflect on my own health and mental stability. If i feel any tension on having a way to get alone time i feel a lot of stress and anxiety . I also am more of a loner type and much prefer to stay to myself . I do have a social life i just need to know at the end of the day i have a quiet place where i can relax and that helps your stress and anxiety which is needed for healthy living. Ive always loved my time being alone .
a few days or weeks at most is good but after that its bad fornyour mental heatlh

I enjoy spending time alone because I am able to do whatever I want to do without having to think about someone else or what they want to do. For example, I can eat whatever I want when I'm by myself and don't have to take into consideration what sounds good to someone else.
I think that spending time alone is mostly a positive experience for me. It allows me to "recharge" myself for what has for me.

While I would not want to be alone all of the time, I do quite enjoy quiet moments alone. I relish the opportunity to do as I please, try something new, or be creative without judgment. I also find the quiet relaxing and re-energizing. I think it is generally a positive experience for me because I enjoy my own company and also because I have a very client-oriented job. When I'm working I need to be very "on" all of the time, so it's quite relaxing to pursue my own interests, just be with my thoughts, or even do nothing at all when I'm off work and alone.

i like to be by myself. even though it is good to socialize, being by yourself in away is important. this is where you get to learn about yourself and seek God about who he wants you want to be and that within itself is chore. sometimes being alone is to prepare for what is going to come in life, so that when you are around people you will not how to interact with each other because you will be in the right mind space.
Spending time alone allows me to decompress whenever I've interacted with people for too long, which is draining for me. I consider it to be both positive and peaceful.

As a chronically single person, it is very negative to be this lonely. I feel very exhausted and very depressed. It does not feel good knowing that you will eat alone and spend most days alone as well. It is a very sad existence.

I enjoy my own company. Being alone allows me to decompress and distance myself from the world at large. It allows me to think clearly, almost speak to myself (internally, mind you), and to feel more centered/connected with my own ideologies, experiences, and outlook. It's a break from all the emotional labor I do to move throughout life on a daily basis.
Race_7_TEXT: Mixed. Guess I can't select more than one.

BeliefsTimeAloneOpen: Being alone is refreshing, but can be lonely if depressed. I think being alone is best knowing that you will have companionship waiting for the future.

I love spending time alone. I wish I could do it all the time. I have no issues entertaining myself and being alone allows me to orchestrate my whole environment without worrying about everyone else around me and if they're uncomfortable. I'm able to finally relax and take time to enjoy whatever I need to at that time.

Spending time alone is a great experience for me. I get to do whatever I want and keep thoughts to myself. I have more time to think and relax and not have to worry about distractions from others. I love being in my own space and not having to consider others very often.

I think of time being alone as positive, because it allows me time to get to know myself better and get rid of stress and dealing with other people, which is not something that I like to do often. I fell that being alone is also positive, because it allows me to think through my problems and able to really think about my goals, problems, future, past and where I would like to go or what I would like to put and stop to and change in the near future.

Honestly, spending time alone is hit-or-miss. Sometimes I wish I could have more time to myself, as I want to do things without making noise or distracting others, or others distracting me with noise. Sometimes, it is nice to have quiet time, and thus spending time alone is a big positive thing. Not to mention being able to sleep when I want to. However, spending time alone can be pretty lonely, especially if I want to talk with someone and nobody is around for me to do so.

I mostly think being alone is a positive experience and I've largely felt that way since I was a kid.  I tend to be very introverted and while I'm not necessarily uninterested in other people, I do prefer to do my own thing and immerse myself within my own interests.

I love being alone and I actually go out to eat by myself sometimes just to read and enjoy time to myself or people watch. I enjoy it because I am don't like being around people who constantly want to talk and run my social meter out
I'm a very introverted person and very much need regular time alone. I find it peaceful and comfortable.

In general, it is a positive to me, but I not to the extent that I currently am alone.

I have a high tolerance for being alone. I can get stressed easily around other people. I have plenty of interests to keep me occupied when alone. However, I worry that it is not good for my mental health to be alone too often. I lack social stimulation.

In addition, there are times I wish I had someone to share my experiences with (not that I never do).

I think that for me i can see it as a bit of a mix of both. But overall i find it to be more positive than negative. As i use the time i have alone to decompress and relieve some stress and do some things that i enjoy so that i can have a more relaxing rest of the day

I think everyone needs time alone to think and just let the stress go . for me i like going to this park where you can see a body of water and trees and ducks and it just makes me at ease. its where i get to go calm down and just breathe like all my problems dont seem to big and seem doable.

Spending time alone is a positive and enjoyable experience. It allows me time for myself and I can reflect on things that are important to me. I am able to do activities that I want to do without worrying about asking someone else. I am able to do things on my own term and things that benefit me. I see spending time alone as essential because you always need time to yourself after being around people.
I think spending time alone is positive because it lets me recharge.

I love my alone time, and find it invigorating. Being able to pursue whatever I like, without having to maintain relationships with others is very therapeutic for me. Obviously I do love being social as well, but I need a healthy balance.

I love spending time alone. In fact, I probably wouldn't mind going months without seeing another person or even seeing any signs of humanity. In another life, I might have been a hermit or a monk. One day, I want to build a shed (err, I mean tiny house) in the middle of the woods out in the middle of nowhere, and spend the rest of my life there working on my magnum opus and whatever else I find interesting. I'm a huge fan of DOS and early windows and I'd love to be able to spend my time puttering around with vintage computers.

Without the need to obsess about work or money, I might also have time to study electronics. It would be cool to create an 8088 that's more power efficient than the original (the original, for example, didn't actually decrease energy usage or whatnot when you issued the HLT instruction; it just waited for the next interrupt via a kind of busy-waiting), and that was powered not by a beefy power supply, or worse, batteries- which are all destined for the landfill- but by a hand crank. I guess you could just store it all in some high-capacity capacitors. Just don't touch them or it'll give you quite a zap!

I also like the sounds of nature and spending time outside. It would be nice to have some space to grow things. I probably wouldn't want cattle though since they're so time consuming; I'm more of a pet person than a cattle person. I wouldn't grow all my food, but I would rely on dumpster diving at grocery stores, just as I do today. In fact, I haven't set foot in a grocery store in years, and I'm using the saved money to fund my (hopefully early) retirement and to buy land in the future.

I don't do too well in jobs or in relationships with people. I guess it's because of my unusual mannerisms, and I'm just not spontaneous enough to make good conversation. If I had a couple minutes to think of every response and I didn't feel so much anxiety and pressure when I was with people, maybe it would be different. Anyway, I don't mind being a loner. Companionship might be nice, but this is my lot, and thankfully I enjoy solitude.

I find spending time alone to be a neutral experience. I don't feel strong emotions when doing something mundane passively or actively. However, I would feel relaxed or content when doing something I enjoy. So if I had to pick one, I would be more inclined to say that it is a positive experience for me.

I think spending time alone is very positive because allows you to unwind, relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of life. Time alone is where I tend to find my creativeness and recuperation. It also allows me to balance my life.

I enjoy spending time alone. It gives me time to reflect on things that have happened to me or pursue an interest without interruption. I prefer to spend the majority of my time alone, I used to be the opposite, and would always like to be out with others experiencing whatever the world had to offer. Now I prefer to read about it, but I do think sometimes that I need to stop spending so much time by myself and try to build up my life beyond me.

I think about being alone as a positive experience because I am able to think about personal experiences and concerns. With being alone, I am able to think freely without dealing others' issues. I believe that being alone can help me unplug from the craziness of the current world.

Spending time alone is a great thing for me.  Although I am pleasantly sociable when with others, whether people I know or strangers, I prefer my own company.  I find it relaxing.  I love the quiet and the lack of distraction (not having to make conversation), which allows me to spend a lot of uninterrupted time doing research and creative projects--endeavors that are very important to me. I don't feel lonely when I'm alone.

It's positive for me because I am able to engage in the hobbies that I like. I have time to think about my actions, think about what I want to do and have done, and it helps me to improve. The negative aspect is that it can take a toll on my social ineptness.
I think spending time alone is a positive for me because spending a lot of time around people can be draining.

I quite enjoy being alone. It gives me the mental space i need for my thoughts. I don't have to worry about anyone else's comfort, or preference. I can let my thoughts wander, and do things at my own pace.

Generally speaking, spending time alone is a positive experience for me. I am an introvert and use the time to destress and take time for myself. I am not a social nor conversive person, and while I may sometimes prefer to be sharing the same space as someone else, I will usually excuse myself to be alone after my (lack of) social skills are exhausted.

I have been totally alone for three years. Just my cat and I, the people I lived with and loved died not long before covid and left me alone. I am terrified of covid because if I get too sick to work my cat and I will be homeless, so I never leave my apartment. I only have one friend left and we text but that is it. 
I have always been a people person and being left alone is not something I would recommend. At this point I am completely numb, I don't feel much of anything any more except concern for my cat. I am pretty sure numb is how I survive. 
My life could be far worse. i work remotely seven days a week and barely manage to pay my bills. I stream video at night, watch progressive politics,  drink some wine, sleep and repeat. I see a human every week or two when I get a grocery delivery. 
Um, let's see, there is not much to say, that is my life. Thank the universe for cats.

Spending time alone is a positive and peaceful experience for me. I find it recharging and refreshing to spend time alone reading, watching television, or listening to music/podcasts. I am an introvert, although I do enjoy people, but my safe space is by myself enjoying an activity.
I think that spending time alone is a very positive experience for me. I really enjoy the quiet time, and time to reflect to myself.

I have always spent time alone. Knowing oneself is critical, as we are with ourselves 24/7. If you know who you are, what you want, what you need, what drives you, what motivates you, what you can and cannot and will and will not put up with, what you are truly good at, not good at, what you like, don't like and think critically and thoughtfully and deliberately and reflect on experiences with and for yourself, you are better to you, to others who matter, family, friends, everyone. I see nothing negative about spending time alone unless someone experiences loneliness. I have done things alone happily since I was a teenager and still prefer to work out alone as it is my solitary time away from my family (which I consider highly important in marriages and as we co-parent).

I think spending time alone is a positive experience. The atmosphere belongs to you solely in this period where you can focus and think about what you should in your life. Mull over things in life and getting priorities straight. Other occasions can be meditate and such other mentally focusing or mentally relaxing actions. They can serve to help to sort issues out with that time.

I'm ok with being alone most of the time. I don't have to worry about keeping up a conversation with others or what they will think about me. I wouldn't want to be alone all the time but most of the time it is ok. Also, I am married with three children and I am hardly ever alone. I really appreciate times when I can just have peace, and quiet, and some time to myself. I can also think clearly which is a nice change from most of the time when there's always something going on. I would definitely say that time alone is a positive experience for me.

Spending time alone is mostly a positive experience for me. I deal with coworkers all week so having my own time to enjoy is priceless. I am a very introverted person and I prefer to enjoy things myself for the most part i.e. I don't think I need to be around others to fully enjoy an experience. 

There are times when this is not true however. Loneliness accumulates over time and eventually I need to be around my loved ones or friends to enjoy something, things like food events (BBQs), birthdays, movie theater showings. 

I think growing up in America influences these feelings. We are sometimes thought to believe that independence is a part of the culture, and with migrant parents where family is a huge value, it kind of splits things down the middle.
I love being by myself. It’s a time for me to recharge and reflect.

I'm very introverted and I require a lot of alone time to feel stable. If I'm around other people for too long with no alone time, I'll start to get very irritable, anxious, and overwhelmed. Being alone allows me to relax, connect with my inner experience, and engage with my passions and hobbies. I only find it to be lonely and negative if I'm isolating myself excessively as a coping mechanism for mental health struggles and shutting out all external offers of help.
Spending time along gives me a chance to collect my thoughts with few distractions. It allows me to spend my time however I want.

I like having time to myself to relax and decompress. But I'm not always sure it's healthy for me. I was very lonely as a teenager after going through some really rough experiences, and I think I shorted out the part of my brain that's able to feel lonely, or mind it. Now it's like I'm numb to the pain and don't know how to seek people out. I think I spend too much time alone even though I feel fine about it and even enjoy it. I think people can enjoy things that aren't what's best for them.

I am somewhat introverted and like to have time alone to recharge and focus on my well being and interests. However, I still like a moderate degree of social interaction. So it's not an issue where I can't stand being alone and always have to be with someone, always have to have a romantic partner, go out of my way to not be alone etc. Nonetheless, due to chronic health issues, I am often alone way more than I would like to be and even more than that, and it feels unhealthy. But I don't know a good solution for it. I tried online gaming and social media as a way to interact despite the health issues, but online interaction is not the same or as beneficial as in person interaction. So, I don't mind being alone in normal amounts, but I currently feel I am alone too much due to circumstances I can't really control.
It is good as long as you spend time occupying your mind.  It is a good way to unwind and relax.  I find it very fun because I do the things I want to do.
I personally don't generally enjoy talking or interacting with people as a whole. I can and have previously gone months without talking to anyone, and I've always preferred it that way.
I enjoy being alone because I want to do things on my own timetable but I'm very much an extroverted person who loves being around people but I don't mind being alone.

Since there are both positive and negative aspects involved, I do not really put a positive or negative spin on spending time alone. I will say that when I was younger, I spent a greater amount of time trying to hangout with other people than I do as I have gotten older. I think there are many reasons for this, some good and some bad, but I would still not label the entirety of being alone as "good or bad".

i think being alone can be a fairly vital tool in introspection. Especially now, it's very common to exist entirely in a miasma of noise. Not necessarily unpleasant noise, it can be music, podcasts, sounds, conversation, just the background noise of reality, but still noise. Being alone can give one the opportunity to fully tune in to one's own thoughts in a way that's becoming increasingly rare

Spending time alone is definitely a positive experience for me I'm an introvert. Being around people who are super chatty is extremely draining. If I've had a busy day at work that involves talking to people or answering phones, I need time to decompress and recharge, otherwise I'm in a bad mood.

In my case I think I spend too much time alone.  I don't have many friends and I have a bit of social anxiety so I tend to spend most of my time alone.  I do feel lonely often but I have gotten used to being alone for the most part.  Sometimes it is wearing on my mental health and makes me discouraged.  I had 2 cats for most of my adult life and I found that makes being alone easier.  To have something to care for and take care of.  They have passed away recently of old age and I've noticed I've felt more lonely since then.  I haven't felt ready for more pets at this point because I miss mine so much.
Having time to myself is a peaceful experience and I like to use it to read, do gardening, go for a walk, or do exercise.  I love my family but I like the occasional freedom from everyone.

I spend so much of my time alone that I have come to look on it as a mostly positive experience.  I know that I have myself to rely upon and that gives me some courage to try and expand my skills or do new things.
I'm an introvert. I need time to recharge and relax.

For me, being alone is a positive experience. I'm introverted and socially anxious, so being alone allows me to gather myself. It's a lot of work for someone like me to keep up with society. When I'm not busy interacting with people, I enjoy alone time. My internet-connected devices keep me company. I can always kill time by ruminating, writing, sleeping, or cleaning.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me. It gives me the time and space to reflect on how I am feeling and what I am feeling. I can prioritize my own activities and make a determination of how to spend my time without being distracted. I am not distracted by or focused on the needs of others, so I am able to spend my time and energy on the activities of my choosing, whether for work or pleasure.
I think it is very healthy and positive to spend time alone. I am very comfortable being on my own and get more done since I am free of distractions.
i like being around people, sometimes being alone is alright but it gets a little boring and lonely after awhile, i used to like it more but not as much since the pandemic

I think it is a very positive experience for me.  When I'm with people, my thoughts get clouded with distraction and I don't feel like I can concentrate on the things I want to focus on.  I also don't feel like I can be my true self around most everyone.  When I'm alone I do not have any social pressures influencing my behavior and I can say, think, and do whatever I want.  This is a very liberating feeling for me.
I think spending time alone is a positive experience. I am an introvert and I enjoy being alone.

For several years of my adult life, I didn't think I could stand being alone. Every waking minute of my life, I was on the go, meeting people and making friends. It didn't matter what kind of people they were as long as I had someone to talk to and wasn't by myself. That quickly led to me making poor choices. I let all of my "friends" influence me in ways that were not healthy for me. I also ended up with several worthless men because I thought having someone was better than having no one. 
It took a long time and a lot of mistakes but I finally learned that I am enough for me. I don't need to be around people every moment in order to be happy. In fact, I found that I made better life choices when I depended on myself to make my choices rather than allow others to lead me. As a bonus, I learned that I didn't need to be a man to be happy and, therefore, no longer had to answer to anyone. I don't have to compromise on anything if I don't want to.
I still have friends and I still have a significant other, but I have them on my terms - after I've spent enough time with my favorite person - ME.

There is absolutely no negative aspect of spending time alone, and I would argue that it is even better for one's mental health to just avoid unnecessary human contact. Being around people means that you are constantly subject to being influenced or judged, and for many people that means they will have to suppress their true selves or change their attitude to avoid being socially-censured/or offended in a non-verbal way (such as unfriendly glares or body language). Staying away from people allows you to live in a way that your values aren't challenged,  you don't need to make compromises, and you aren't constantly judged or socially threatened due to your beliefs, behavior, looks, choices etc.

Well, to some degree, I'm probably less affected, in that I have a longtime partner to whom I've been married for 24 years -- plus, we also had five years of pre-marriage/courtship history. So not surprisingly, she's the one that I spend most of my time with, as it should be.

That being said, long before my wife appeared in my life, I often spent major periods of my life alone. That started when I was a teenager, and my mother was actually institutionalized. My father worked long hours in his contracting business, which meant that he couldn't pick up my sister to/from school, as we'd been accustomed to doing. 

So we both actually had to use the bus -- separate buses, by the way, not the same one -- and cook what we'd learned to cook for ourselves when we got home. Then we had to sit down and do our homework, or if we wanted to relax, we had to find ways to do that -- this was the '70s, so way before our 24/7 cellpohone/social media-driven-all-on-all-the-time culture emerged.

None of this was necessarily fun, since we all had a lot of anxiety about what would happen to Mom -- though she eventually came home -- and there were issues with finances, too. But my sister and I did learn a lot about how to direct ourselves, and focus ourselves, on what we needed to get done. So in that sense, it was good, because we had to learn how to do things for ourselves, which served as good preparation for when we got older.

And that's how I've always approached being alone. Again, long before my wife showed up, I often had to take that approach -- I lived at home, but my dad was often doing his own thing, work-wise, and my mom slept a lot (due to her various mental and physical issues). 

So again, I had to find ways to amuse myself -- which became a lot of easier, once I got interested in music, and started playing instruments. I also developed a strong interest in writing, which (of course) is a solitary art in itself, for the most part. I also developed outside interests -- like Drama Club, of which I was a member, in high school -- to fill in those gaps when my parents weren't around, or my sister was doing her own thing.

And that's what I would advise other folks to do -- find something you like to do on your own, and pick things that are happening where you live, to give you those opportunities to make social connections with others, even if it's being in a crowd at a high school play, or a live music show. That works best for me, and it may work best for you, too, depending on how you look at it.
For me I think time alone is positive because I can be alone with my thoughts and do what I want and or need to do without other people around.

Spending time alone can be both a positive and a negative experience for me depending on how I feel at the time. If I am in a good mental space and/or I have plans then spending time alone is good. I also enjoy spending time alone if I have been overwhelmed lately. Spending time alone can be negative if I am anxious or bored.
I usually enjoy time alone as it allows me to do things at my own pace with no pressure and no distractions.

Sometimes I like to spend time alone. After a long hard work day I just need time alone to relax. There are days though when I am forced to spend time alone because my family is doing other things and those times feel very lonely and boring.

I think spending time alone is usually a positive experience, and it is necessary to spend time alone if you want to improve your skill at most things.  For example, it would be difficult to develop ability at a musical instrument if you could only play along with other people.  You could play guitar by yourself while spending time in the same room as somebody else, but they might be annoyed by your repetitive playing, and you might be bothered by the sounds they're making.  You can develop a uniquely intimate connection with a musical instrument or with a musical recording if you spend time with it alone.
