Although I do think that more people should learn to appreciate the time that they spend alone, I do often feel lonely, and I would like to spend less time by myself, so I do think that there is a limit to how much time I want to spend alone.

I enjoy alone time as it allows me to decompress after work. I have a good balance of time with family and friends and then time alone to workout, read, or just relax. It is important part of my week.
Spending time alone is mainly a positive experience for me, as it allows my social battery to recharge so that I can therefore spend more time with others later on.

I think alone time is a positive experience for me. It allows me to decompress and reflect on my day. I feel more productive when I am alone than if I am surrounded by other people that can distract me easily. While I do not think living in complete isolation is good, I do think that people (myself included) need time to be by themselves. This allows me to be my full self and not worry about what is around me

For me this time, is a time for growth and energize myself again. I spend a lot of time socializing and working so sometimes I need to recharge, and that's what I do when I'm by myself. It's mostly positive to me, but I do realize that it would be negative if it would be too much alone time.

I think it is important to spend some time alone with your thoughts. I grew up as a youngest child, but my sisters were a lot older and moved out when I was young. I was raised more like an only child. I got used to using my imagination and playing by myself. It is a lonely way to grow up. Yes, it can be lonely being alone. But I got used to it. Now I value time spent just by myself with my thoughts. I relish time alone. It can be relaxing and provide valuable insights.

I find spending time alone to be a mix of both positive and negative experiences. There are moments when I genuinely enjoy the peace and tranquility of solitude. It gives me the chance to unwind, recharge, and engage in activities I love, like reading or pursuing my hobbies. During these moments, I feel a sense of freedom and self-discovery that boosts my overall well-being.

However, there are also times when being alone can trigger feelings of loneliness and isolation. During such moments, I might yearn for social connections and feel a sense of disconnect from others. This negative aspect of solitude sometimes leads to overthinking or dwelling on certain worries, which can impact my mood and mental state.

I have noticed that my perception of spending time alone often depends on the context and my current emotional state. When I'm in a positive mood or have specific tasks to focus on, solitude feels like a welcomed and enjoyable break from the busy world. On the other hand, during periods of stress or uncertainty, being alone might exacerbate negative thoughts and feelings.

While I appreciate the moments of solitude that allow me to recharge, I also recognize the importance of balancing it with meaningful social interactions. Engaging in quality time with friends and loved ones helps me feel connected, supported, and emotionally fulfilled.

Overall, I believe that spending time alone can have both positive and negative aspects, and it's crucial for me to be mindful of my emotions and needs during these moments. Striking a balance between solitude and social interactions allows me to experience the benefits of both and contributes to my overall mental well-being.

I, think spending time alone is alright but if you spend too much time alone it is not good. I believe everyone needs someone for something in life. Being alone can be very depressing. Sometimes people choose to be alone. where others do not like to be alone. Some can be alone for short periods of time and others be be alone for long periods. Being alone is also mental isolation. Which is not good for us to be lonely at the end of the day everybody needs somebody.
Being alone is a positive experience because I get a lot done. I can focus on being productive.

I think spending time alone is one of the healthiest nd positive things to do, you are able to think about your life, put things in place, plans you want to undertake, and reflect on your life to know what you have to work on or improve on and also what to make better or keep doing.
 Spending time alone does not just give you alone time, away from all the troubles of this world but rather, it is a major part of self-care.

Spending time alone allows you to do many things without much expectations unlike spending time with others. You can practice hobbies, take part in your interests and relax without much care. However spending time alone can get lonely sometimes since you're not spending time with anybody in person.

For me it is a positive thing but I still would like to work on it. Growing up I was a doormat, I would let people treat me however they see fit because i wanted to be loved because i wasn't receiving any support or love at home. A few years ago, I made the conscious decision to be alone and just focus on my mental health and i have no regrets, I've become more self reliant, wiser, open minded, set boundaries and just have overall peace in my life that I never had before. Sure it gets lonely but now that i am in a better place and i am ready to let people in.

Honestly, spending time alone can be positive or negative. It can be positive in the sense that you get to sing quietly and deeply, and not be bothered by anybody. But if you are alone more and more, you could potentially start to become needy to that feeling, and then all you wanna do is be alone.
I think spending time alone is a positive experience. I enjoy not being interupted or distracted by other people. I also enjoy recharging because I find time with other people to be very draining.

I live in a pretty highly-populated area of the country.  I have to interact with hundreds of people every single day.  Being around people is great on so many different levels, and I love learning about their lives and you never know what you're going to get from person-to-person.  All that being said, there is nothing better than just coming home and being alone, away from everyone.  I don't have to speak to anyone if I don't want to, and it's just peaceful.  I think it's not only healthy, but necessary to give yourself a break from people.  Sure, I get lonely occasionally like anyone, but I live with my girlfriend and sometimes I don't even want to speak to her.  I just want to be alone.  Being alone doesn't bother me in the slightest.

It depends on where I am in my cycle (female) or how much has been doing on in my life. Some days I really enjoy having alone time and find it as an opportunity to be productive or practice some self-care. Other times I get lonely with more negative thoughts wishing I had people around me and feeling badly about my life.

For me, being alone these days is very much a choice, and something I spent a lot of time deciding on how to approach. I have had varying degrees of social circles throughout my life, and I find that I am most comfortable these days with a small circle, and with lots of alone time to focus on myself and my goals. I find other people to be distracting from my personal goals a lot of the time, and I get more accomplished by myself, when I can focus on improving myself and my life without others.
It is a very positive experience to be alone sometimes because it gives peace of mind and one is able to meditate which puts their stressful mind to ease.

I don't mind being alone sometimes. Other times I want someone to talk to and engage with. It depends on what mood I am in at the time and whether I am doing something I enjoy alone or prefer to enjoy with others.

I am an only child so I have kind of always spent time alone when not with parents, friends, cousins etc. I have defintelty became accustomed to my me time each day, i love having the time to unwind and relax and just exist without judgement, not that my family and friends even were judging me but I have anxiety about social situations sometimes. I do get lonely after spending too much time alone and know that I need to be around someone to get out of that funk. Overall, spending time alone is really important to me and is fun if you make it fun, but I can only take so much of it.

I enjoy being alone. I have spent much of my life/ time around other people and do not feel rushed to get back to them. I still experience occasioinal fomo, but I do not miss people per se. When I am alone it does not matter what mood I am in. I do not have to carefully monitor my behavior. I am free from judgement. If i want company I can have a pet. I can spend my time as I want. I can not spend it at all. I have time to be with myself as company. I have time to my own thoughts without also monitoring others. I have freedom of choice.

Spending time alone is something I experience sometimes, and my thoughts about it vary depending on the situation. Sometimes, being alone feels positive and enjoyable. It gives me a chance to recharge and have a peaceful moment away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. 

When I'm feeling balanced and empowered, solitude can be a gift. I believe finding a healthy balance between solitude and social interaction is essential for overall well-being. Embracing alone time for self-care and reflection is a positive.
I think spending time alone is positive because I am able to put me first, and I am able to reflect on my life and put things in place.

Spending time alone is usually a positive experience for me. I get to do what I want, whenever I want, and however I want. I am in control of my own time, thoughts and actions when I am alone. Most of my hobbies are best done alone, such as spending time watching TV or movies, listening to music, and practicing playing the guitar. I enjoy being alone most of the time.
I believe spending time alone is a positive experience because it gives you time to think and be yourself free from other people. For me it gives me time to recharge.

Initially, alone time is healthy and good for you.  Everyone needs time alone to clear their heads, have some peace and quiet, do the things they want to do, and maybe have a chance to think some things through.

But, like many things, too much of a good thing turns bad.  Too much time alone makes me sad, disheartened, lonely, and I start feeling a little hopeless.  Further, extended periods of being alone repeated over many months and years can have disastrous effects on one's mood and life -- especially once you get to the point that social skills start deteriorating from disuse.  Believe me.

I think being alone is a positive experience most of the time. I find being around people to be a negative experience most of the time. It's either stressful or weird. It's kind of hard to talk about because its so negative. Everyone seems to prefer talking about superficial BS instead of interesting subjects. And the same 5 subjects are always being talked about by people usually. Maybe when they're saying something interesting is when they clam up when you come around. Otherwise, I've rarely heard anyone talk about anything interesting. It's mostly 85% boring stuff, 5% slightly interesting stuff, and maybe 10% interesting stuff. Give or take.

Spending time alone is like being between a rock and a hard place for me. On one hand, I need alone time to recharge after being social or spending time in public. On the other, I struggle with mental illnesses that drive my sense to isolate. I isolate very often, because I'm scared of connections to people. I'm scared of people dying or of them not liking me. I'm scared of confrontation. I do enjoy my alone time when I need to recharge, but I don't enjoy it when it becomes an impulsive yet uncontrollable pit of escape and misery. I wish there was a balance, but I think it will take a lot of time to find the middle ground- if there is one.

To me, spending time is a positive experience.  It gives me a chance to relax and enjoy doing whatever I want without fear of interruption from my children or husband.  It allows me to think about anything that is stressing me out and work out a solution.  I feel that it recharges my batteries and allows me to be the best version of myself.

It's important to have some alone time. During this time we can recharge ourselves. We get to know ourselves. One is faced with their own moral barometer during alone time. Often I first balk at the idea of alone time I balk at it, I feel resistant, but then I settle into the idea. It's a chance to read, reflect, practice skills, pray, meditate, things I wouldn't do around others. Solitude is a necessary part of being a whole person.

Currently spending time alone is a positive for me. I have a family with two young children, so I have a lot of responsibility throughout every day. I never really have a chance for peace and quiet, so being alone would be an opportunity for this. My job also entails me to be around a lot of people for the entire day, with no opportunity to be alone the whole day, so being alone would be a nice break and allow me to reset and enjoy some peace and quiet again as well.
I love spending time alone on a daily basis, and it helps me to shut out the world. I prefer to spend my alone time doing things that make me happy.

I have always enjoyed your time alone. I'm able to do things that i  like without having other people bothering me. I have an active internal life so I can entertain myself. But I definitely get lonely and with want to spend time with others more than I'm able to. It's good to be around other people in healthier.

I think it's a positive experience mostly because everyone needs time to unwind. For me alone time is essential because everyone needs time to reflect on their own with no other input -- like a sort of mirror or self-perception unreachable without the intrusion or connection with others. People need to be social somewhat sometimes, but also sometimes most people need some non-social times too -- and it's about time we understand that you need both sides of it balanced well enough. I don't think you can be healthy socializing too much, just as you can't be healthy avoiding any sense of socializing either.

Spending time alone places a heavier emphasis on what I'm thinking and feeling and how I can best connect with myself and offer myself the support I need in order to feel more fulfilled. I see spending time alone as a privilege and a way to maintain a healthy relationship with myself.

I generally thing spending time alone is a positive experience for me. I go through phases of wanting to be around other people but I am generally happy to spend time alone. I like to relax and do things my own way. It also lets me be creative and get things done.

I see alone time as an experience that can be positive or negative. It is positive, as it allows me to reflect, process information and promote self-knowledge, improving my professional skills. However, I can experience loneliness and social disconnection in times of prolonged isolation. I seek to balance solitude with meaningful social interactions to maintain a healthy and productive environment.

Spending time alone iis positive for me. It allows me to relax without having to talk. I can meditate. I can listen to music. I can watch Netflix. I can play video games. I can read a book. I can take a nap. I can just be myself.

I feel that sometimes when you are alone it gives you time to reflect on yourself and what you have done with your life. Then as time goes on it starts to get boring there is no one to turn to and be able to share my thoughts and what I think about things, I find that when I am alone I get more things done, than after I am done I start to feel that I need someone to talk to or to express myself and my feelings.
ひとりで過ごす時間はとても肯定的なものだと思います。他の人に煩わされずに落ち着いて自分の考えをまとめたり、好きなことをすることができます。自分のアイデンティティを形成する上で大切な時間です。
私は一人で過ごす時間はとても寂しいと思います。私には一人で行う趣味がなく、一人でいても退屈で誰かと話したくなってしまいます。SNSの友達は少しはいますが、ネット上で話していてもやはり寂しさは変わりません。

私はひとりで時間を過ごすことに否定的な感情はありません。
私はひとりで過ごすときでも自ら楽しみを見つけることが出来、また必要なら休憩に使っています。
私はひとりでの時間を有意義に使うことが出来るので、そこに否定的な感情が入る余地がありません。

ひとりでいる時間は誰にも気を使わなくていいので精神的にリラックスした状態でいられて、日常生活の人間関係で疲れた心を休められるリフレッシュタイムだと思っています。また、誰にも邪魔されることがなく、好きなことを好きなようにできる自由で楽しい時間でもあります。現在ではネットがあるので、一人でいても誰かと繋がっているような感覚があり、寂しさを感じることもほとんどありません。
以上の理由から、私はひとりで過ごす時間をとても肯定的に思っています。
私にとって一人で過ごす時間は、仕事や人間関係を忘れ、趣味や好きなことをやってリラックスできる大切な時間です。
1人で過ごす時間にはかなり肯定的です。何故なら誰の目も気にしないで好きなことが出来るし、気を遣わなくて済むからです。
ひとりで過ごす時間は自分にとって重要である。他人にわずらわされる事なく自分の考えをまとめる事ができるし、リラックスする事もできる。世間で生きている以上他人と全くかかわらないという事はないので、それによって生じるストレスを解消する目的としてもひとりで過ごす時間は重要である。
一人で過ごすのは肯定的な時間だと感じます。誰からも干渉されることが無く、自由な時間を過ごせることがメリットであり、ストレスを感じる事がない点も良いと感じます。

「ひとりで過ごす時間」は肯定的に捉えていて、かつ必要だと感じます。日々の生活の中で体験したことを基に、新しい思考や論理をまとめ上げていくことは非常にクリエイティブなことだと感じるからです。またその日に起こったことなどを客観的に把握し、総括していくことも重要です。「ひとりで過ごす」のは寂しいという感情もあるとは思いますが、これらの活動は「ひとりの時間」でこそ練度を上げていけると思います。どんなに忙しい中でも、時間を工面して「ひとりの時間」を作ることは必要だと感じます。

実家で家族と暮らしで、寝たきりの母の介護をほぼ付きっきりでしていて、その他は家事などに追われる日々を過ごしており、母が寝たきりになったからは、訪問介護の人達などの出入りが多くなり、もともと人付き合いが苦手な私にとっては、心身ともに疲れきっている状態なのですが、家族が寝静まった時間帯に、ゆっくりと自分一人時間を過ごす事が、唯一の楽しみになっています。どんなに疲れていても、夜遅くまで起きて、好きな音楽を聴いたり、動画を見たりして、自分自身を保とうとしている感じがします。
一人で過ごす時間はあまり好きではありません。なぜなら余計な過去や未来のことを考えてふさぎ込んでしまいがちだからです。
一人で過ごす時間を肯定的に考えています。理由としては周りの目から映る自分を気にしなくても済む為、そういったストレスから離れる事が出来るからです。
１人で過ごすことは、誰にも邪魔されずありのままの自分でいられるので、とても必要な時間だと思っている。
疲れている時や誰にも会いたくない時にはひとりで過ごす時間は必要なのでかなり肯定的です

1人で過ごす時間は、私にとって必要不可欠なもので、非常に肯定的です。
誰にも何にも煩わせることなく、落ち着いて過ごせ、好きなことができるのでとてもリラックスできます。ゆっくり本を読んだり、趣味を楽しんでいるので、寂しいと思うこともありません。

とても肯定的です。
理由は、気楽だし自由だし、ストレスを感じないし、物事にゆっくり考えられるので、ひとりで過ごす時間はとても大切な時間です。

私はひとりで過ごす時間に対しては非常に肯定的です。
仕事や私生活で人と接すると楽しいこともありますが、嫌なこともたくさんあります。その嫌なことを忘れるためにもひとりで過ごす時間が大切ではないかと考えます。
特に現代におけるストレス社会においては、ひとりで過ごす時間の重要性が高まっていると思います。
食事をする時も、大勢で食べるのもいいですが、自宅でひとりで好きなものを食べる瞬間は格別です。また、ひとり焼肉やひとりカラオケなど本来は複数人で行うこともひとりで行くことによって自分のやりたい放題です。
ひとりで過ごす時間が充実していればしているほど、人生を楽しめている証拠だと思っています。
ひとりで過ごす時間にはかなり肯定的です。理由は自分らしくいられる貴重な時間であること、誰にも邪魔されずに自分だけの好きなことに集中できるのでストレスを感じることがないからです。

ひとりで過ごすのは本来自分は得意な方ではないです。育った環境が大家族だったのと自分の部屋もなかったので、大勢の中で自分の好きなことをして過ごすという習慣ができました。ひとりで過ごすこと自体は楽しめるのですが、完全にひとりきりの状態というのがどうも苦手で、誰かの存在を感じていないと不安になってしまい、いつものことがいつものようにできなくなることもあります。だからといっていつもいつも誰かがいる状況やが好きなわけではないです。自分の必要とするときに必要な距離でそばに誰かがいてくれることが大事です。いい年をした大人なので、ひとりでいることができないわけではないですが、みんなでワイワイ楽しく過ごせるパーティーなんかはとても好きで、自分が中心になっていなくても集団の中にいるだけで安心感というものはあります。でも最近は、結局みなひとり、みな自分のために行動している。という考えが強くなり、もっとひとりでいるということに積極的になっていきたいと考えています。人間としての成熟度が高まると思いますし、人生を送っていく上で自分が幸せになるにはひとりで過ごす時間を大切にしないと、たよれるのは最後は自分のみだと思うので他人に依存した生活は大人はすべきではないと思っています。いまのところひとりで過ごすことの方がメリットが多いように感じます。寂しかったり不安だったりすることも克服していきたいと考えて、私はひとりで過ごす時間を強く肯定します。
一人で過ごす時間は誰にも気を遣わずにゆっくりと考え事をしたり、又は何も考えず頭をリラックスさせることが出来る時間だと思っていて、とても肯定的な経験だと思う。

ひとりで過ごす時間は私にとって大切なものです。私はひとりで過ごす時間をとても楽しみます。

ひとりで過ごす時間は私にとって完全に肯定的です。

自分にとってひとりで過ごすのは、有意義かつ必要不可欠な時間であり、ともて肯定的に捉えている。もともとグループで行動を共にするより、一人で考えて実行するのが好きな性格であるのもひとり時間を満喫できる理由かもしれない。ひとりが寂しいと思うことはあまりない。ただ、最近は年を取って来たせいか、誰かから共感されたり誰かと思いを共有したいという気持ちも芽生え、気の置けない相手と一緒に過ごす時間も少しは楽しめるようになってきた。

８割ほど肯定したいです。ストレスを感じた時に誰かと一緒にいると、その誰かに八つ当たりしてしまったり、落ち込んでいることを勘付かせないように気をつかったりして、余計に疲れてしまいます。誰もいないほうが好きに感情を発散したりリラックスしたりできるので、楽な気持になります。

たまにひとりで、でもやっぱり誰かと最終的には一緒にいたいです。
第三者に気を使う必要がないと言う意味で、1人で過ごす時間は私にとってリラックスすることができるとても有意義な時間です。なので、肯定的な経験として捉えています。

肯定的です。

６割程度、肯定的に捉えています。一人でいる時間は心を穏やかにして、自分とゆっくり向き合えるので、とても良いことだと思います。相手がどんな関係であろうと、時には、人と関わることに疲れて体がストレスに感じることが誰しもあるはずです。一人でいれば、不要な言葉が飛び交ったり、自分の考えに変化が加わるような言葉を投げかけられたりすることがありません。そのため、ゆっくり自分のペースで物事を考えたり、無にしたりできるので心身を穏やかに保つことができます。また、自分自身にフォーカスを当てることもできるため、自分が求めていた自分になれたり、自分が知らなかった自分に気づくことができ、より自分自身を好きになれたりすることに繋がります。一人でいることは、結果、幸福感を高め、精神面でも健康的でとても大切なことです。
肯定的です。人間は助け合って生きていきますが、個々はみな一人です。ワガママとかではなく、成熟し自立してこそです。それには、一人でゆっくり過ごす時間が必要で、私のドライな性格にも合っています。

ひとりで過ごす時間については基本的には肯定的です。本人の意思でそうなっている場合についてはという条件はあると思います。後は自分が都会に住んでいるか、地方の特に田舎に住んでいるかにもよると思います。都会ならひとりで過ごすことがむしろ望まれてしまうことも比較的多い気がしますが、地方の田舎の場合には、そのようなひとりで過ごすことにそのままこだわったり気づかないでいると孤立してしまう可能性も、テレビやインターネットで見たりしている限りの情報になりますが、否定できませんので程ほどに自然にというのが良い気がします。

私は1人で過ごす時間に対してとても肯定的です。理由はいくつかありますが、一番の理由は周りに気をつかわず、自分に正直な時間を過ごせるからです。人と過ごす時間ももちろん楽しく好きですが、どうしても周りとのバランスを保たなければなりません。例えば、外食をする際に何を食べるのか意見が分かれた際、私はお寿司、他の全員は焼肉を食べたい気分だとします。私は焼肉の気分でなくても、周りの意見に合わせざるを得なくなります。1人であれば食べたいものを食べたい時に、自由に選ぶ事ができます。他にも旅先でこのような経験がありました。友達2人と旅行をする機会がありましたが、そこまで仲の良い友達ではなかったため、終始何を話せばいいのか分からず、沈黙を避けようと気を遣っていました。また、旅先でどこへ行くか意見が分かれた際も気を遣ってあまり興味のない場所を巡ることになりました。1人であれば自由きままに、もっとリラックスして楽しめたのになあと思いました。1人の時間は自分の意見を尊重し、ある意味わがままに過ごせる贅沢な時間だと考えます。

ひとりで過ごす時間は私に取って７割程度肯定的です。1日のうち、朝と夜に合計2時間有れば満足して過ごせます。

ひとりで過ごす時間が大好きで必要不可欠であり、肯定します。趣味である読書に没頭したり、海外ドラマを見たり、部屋を整えたりする時は常にひとりです。時間を自分だけのためにぜいたくに使えるからです。ただ、何日も誰とも話さずずっと一人でいると気分が落ち込みます。視野が狭くなり、勝手に自分を追いつめて苦しくなってしまうのです。日々の些事について報告や感想を言い合える相手がいることで、人生における嫌な出来事を乗り越えていけます。その点で、完全にひとりですごすのは辛いことです。とはいえ、ひとり時間が大好きなので、人生の８０％はひとりで過ごすことを望みます。この割合が自分にとっていちばん快適なスタイルです。

私は肯定的な意見です。理由は2つあります。
一つ目は、心を無にして過ごせる時間が作れることです。これは家族といえども、子供がいたり、親が一緒に住んでいたりすると、妻や子供、親などに多少なりと気を遣います。一切忘れて活動することで、心も体もリフレッシュすることができるからです。
二つ目は、何かに集中できることです。本を読んだり、勉強したり、副業に励んだり、趣味に没頭したり、と個人で集中し成果を上げたい時があります。その時に集中して活動することができるからです。
ひとり時間は、自分の心のゆとりを持つこと、体や精神の調整に重要な時間だと考えています。ひとり時間が無いと、常にいろいろなことに気を配る性格なので気疲れしてしまい体調を壊してしまう事もありました。ひとり時間でゆっくるするという行為が自分には重要な要素となっています。
余計な気を使わずにリラックスできるので自分には必須の時間
とても肯定的。他人の目を気にせず、趣味や作業などに没頭できる良さがあるから。

かなり肯定的
自分のペースで過ごせる
相手がいないので気を遣わずに済む
ゆっくり調べ物ができる
静かに考えをまとめることができる
私にとっては一人で過ごす時間は至福の時です。好きなものを食べて、好きな動画を見て、好きにリラックスして過ごせる、とても贅沢な時間です。完全に肯定的です。私は一人で過ごす時間が大好きです。

ひとりで過ごす時間にとても肯定的です。
会社でもグループに属し、家でも妻や子どもと過ごす時間が多い。
ひとりで自由に行動できる、考える時間が少ないのでひとりで過ごせる時間は自分だけの時間という意識なので貴重です。
一人で過ごす時間ということに対しては基本的にポジティブです。誰かと過ごす時間というものも悪いとは思いませんが相手を意識して過ごすことになるので楽しいこともありますが不愉快なことも多いです。その点ひとりならばすべて自分で決められるので気楽だし自分に向き合える楽しい時間だと思っています。
一人で過ごす時間についてはかなり肯定的で、誰にも邪魔されることなく、好きなことをできるのは否定する理由が見つかりません。
ゆったり過ごせてリラックスできる時間だから、一人で過ごす時間は肯定的です。
一人で過ごすことは自分の時間が増えるので、今の自分と向き合えるいいタイミングだと思います。一人の時間が多いほど性格や考え方が偏るようなきがします。誰かと一緒なら気持ちや意見を共有して新しい発見が増えるとおもいます
ひ とりで過ごす時間は私にとって、肯定的です。なぜなら他人に気を使わず、好きなことを好きなだけ出来るからです。
ひとりで過ごす時間は、誰にも邪魔されることなく好きなことに打ち込める、とても大切な時間です。他の人に左右されることなく過ごせる時間は、私にとってかけがえのないものです。

ひとりで過ごす時間は、私にとっては大変肯定的です。

他者と過ごす場合、何をするにも他者の意向を踏まえて調整をすることが求められます。すなわち、自由意思に基づく行動がある程度制限されるのです。
対して、ひとりで過ごす場合には自分のやりたいことをやりたいようにやることができるので、極めて自由度が高いといえます。

また、ひとりで過ごす時間というのは、思索に耽ったり、じっくり物事に取り組んだり、何かに集中したりするのに適しています。他者と過ごす場合だと他者とのコミュニケーションは避けられませんし、さほどコミュニケーションを取らなかったとしても完全に他者を意識しないわけにはいきません。
つまり、ひとりでいられるかどうかによって、クリエイティブな、価値ある行動を取れるかどうかが大きく変わってくるのです。
もちろん、他者とのコミュニケーションにより、ひとりで考えているだけでは得られない気づきを得られることもあります。
しかし、そのような気づきを踏まえて何らかのアイデアを形にするのはひとりでいる時間にこそできるものだと考えます。

さらに、人間関係の悩みもひとりの時間では発生しません。
人間はそれぞれ異なる思想や価値観を持つため、他者との関わりはすれ違いやトラブルなどをもたらす可能性があります。そのようなトラブルなどは、多少なりともストレスを感じさせるものです。
ひとりでいる時間の場合、そのようなストレスは発生しません。
もちろん、ひとりでいる時間が長いと、時に寂しさなどの感情を覚えることがあり、別のストレスを抱える可能性もあります。
ですが、前述したように、ひとりでいる時間の方が自由で、生産性も高いのです。他者と過ごす時間も全く不要とは言いませんが、ひとりでいる時間の方が優先されるべきだと考えます。
一人で過ごす時間は、私にとって必要な事です。誰に邪魔される事なく、しなくてはならないことをし、自分がしたいことをきがねなくできる時間がないと、ストレスがたまってしまって、つねにいらいらしてしまいます。誰にも見られる事なく、気にしない時間が必要です。

ひとりで過ごす時間は、とても重要でありとても肯定的である。
誰かと一緒に過ごすということはそれ自体はとても楽しい時間であるが、精神的な疲労は絶対に溜まっていく。
それを解消してくれるのがひとりで過ごす時間であり、これが無ければ心の平穏が保てずにおかしくなってしまうだろう。
また、誰にも気兼ねなく動ける時間となるので普段とは違うことにも挑戦しやすくなり、新しい活動の幅を広げる時間にもなる。
家族や友人と過ごす時間はもちろん大切ですが、1人で考えたり趣味に没頭する時間も必要だと思います。ひとり時間を使って自分の心身をリラックスさせられると思います。
趣味のピアノ弾き、音楽鑑賞読書。後、副業などで一人の時間を過ごします。
肯定的、人付き合いで疲れる事もなく一人でゆっくり出来るので。
ひとりだけで過ごしていると雑念やストレス、過剰な自意識が消え、自分らしく自由に振舞える様になる。他人を一切気にせず好きな事だけに集中出来るので、今後も出来る限りひとりだけの時間を作り、有意義に過ごしたい。

他人との接触することがないため、自分のペースを大切にできます。自分のやりたいことを優先できるので、リラックスした気持ちで過ごせます。
一方で、時と場合によっては、少し寂しい気持ちになることもあります。
他社に気を遣わなくてすむ心を落ち着かせられる時間だと捉えていてかなり肯定的に感じている。
ひとりで過ごしている時間は、ふとした時に寂しさを感じる時もあります。しかし、自分の時間の中で好きなことをするのも心身の疲れを癒せる時間だと考えます。
私にとっては非常に肯定的な経験であり、なくてはならない大切な時間です。なぜなら、ひとりで過ごす時間があることで、自分を見つめることができ、自分と向き合うことができるからです。また、ひとりで過ごす時間は自分が好きなことを存分にできる時間であり、リフレッシュや癒しの時間となるからです。
静かに自分を見つめ直したり、考えたりするのに必ず必要な時間だと感じる
仲間と過ごす時間も大切だが、1人でストレスを発散させる時間も大切だと思う。
うるさい世間から静かな時間を過ごす大切な時間だと感じる
ひとりで過ごす時間は、沈黙が許される環境であり、沈黙があるからこそ思考を高め、有意義な行動へと移すことが可能であると肯定的に考えています。

私自身は「ひとりで過ごす時間」を、とても肯定的にとらえています。その理由としましては、ひとりで過ごすと誰にも邪魔されずに済み、自由な時間を満喫することができるからです。誰か他の人と時間を共にすると、どうしても相手に合わせなければならないことが発生してしまい、ストレスを感じる場面がどうしても出てきます。それに対し、ひとりで過ごすことは、何でも自分で決めることができ、自由に活動することができるので、自分自身も満足できますし、他の誰かに不快な思いをさせることもありません。
自分のタイミングでテレビを見たり、本を読んだり、不快な音に邪魔されず、相手に気遣わなくてもいい一人の時間は絶対に必要なため肯定的。なかったら、他人に冷たく当たる気がする
ひとりで過ごす時間は他の人に気を使ったり干渉を受けたりする事がなく、自由に過ごす事ができて良い経験だと思う

ひとりで過ごす時間は自分にとって必要であり、とても大切な時間です。

何故なら、ひとりだと趣味に没頭することができて、仕事や家事などのストレスを発散することができるからです。

ひとりで過ごしたとしても、家族など自分には大切な人がいるということを忘れることはないので、寂しいとは思いません。
他人と過ごすのも大事な時間だが、その他人が煩わしいことがある。そんな時に1人の空間でいろいろなことを考えるのも大切な時間だと思う。
大勢の人や仲の良い友達と遊んだり楽しんだりするのも良いことだと思うけど、静かに自分の好きなことをして過ごす時間もそれなりに大事だと感じたから。
他のことを考えずに、静かにリラックスして過ごして、自分へのご褒美のような時間なので、肯定的です。
ひとりでいるときに、孤独感や寂しいなどの気持ちにはあまりなったことがありません。主にひとりでいる時間を有意義に、大切に活用していると感じます。

現在63歳です。妻有、子供は、1人で自立しています。
61歳からは、個人年金で生活をやりくりし、64歳から、厚生年金の支給を、65歳から、国民年金を受給予定です。　生活するのに必要な財源の確保できています。
一人で過ごす時間は、妻がパートの仕事時、その他用事がある時です。
一人の時間は、やはり必要だと考えています。
ずっと一緒だと、些細なことで、気分を害し、喧嘩したりします。
一人でいると、興奮しないで、冷静に平常心で考物事をえられるからです。
YouTubeを観たりゲームをしたりなど自由に好きなことをできるため、ひとりで過ごす時間には肯定的である。

I think that spending time alone is positive in that it allows you to relax and think about things. I believe it's important that everyone takes some alone time every now and then. There is a point where it gets unhealthy, such as being involuntarily lonely and wanting to hang out with people but not being able to. For the most part I think it's a positive experience, probably because my social battery tends to run out fairly fast.

I personally love being alone. I find it peaceful and relaxing because I only need to concern myself with my own thoughts, needs, and emotions. Being alone is also time used to process my day, make goals, attain goals and to make plans. Alone time to me is when I get to recharge after a day of pouring my energy into every one and every thing around me. I often find when I am alone I feel inspired and motivated.

I prefer being alone throughout the majority of the day. I have a fair amount of social anxiety and am relatively introverted, so constantly being around people and interacting with them can start to get a bit mentally exhausting. I find that I can be tired for days after trips that involve me being around and interacting with people, whereas I can spend many days alone without feeling too lonely. If I am to spend time around people, I prefer them to be people I know well. I can have meaningful conversation with people and do enjoy some socialization with others, but I feel relaxed and refreshed after a good period of being alone.

I have a hard time talking/dealing with people. I'm quite uncomfortable around them once the small talk is over. I trip over my words, feel over nervous and really hot and just want it to end and get away.
At home I'm very comfortable because I don't have to deal with anyone. I do what I want, when and how I want.
When I was young I grew up with very abusing parents that were mentally, verbally and physically abusive. Then I went and married a man that was the same way. I was with him for over 20 yrs. He drove away any friends or family we had. After Trump was called a narcissist, I realized how much my husband was the same way. All this time he'd convinced me everything no matter how small was my fault. He died 2 yrs ago, so I'm free of him, but the damage has been done. My narcissist  won.

Spending time alone allows me time and space to process any emotions or repetitive thoughts that I've been experiencing. In spending time by myself, I'm able to reflect and dissect my emotions, understanding why I act the way that I do and determining solutions to problems that may arise.

After breaking up with my ex girlfriend that I was with for 16 years I find myself lonely at times. I have trouble sleeping at night in that empty bed. And it's not that I miss her, I just miss having someone else there.

Being alone for periods of time is healthy and allows you to unwind, be yourself, and reflect. However humans are social beings, and too much time alone is extremely bad. Being alone for extended periods of time can cause mental issues, people to be antisocial and awkward, and negatively affect their mood and outlook on life. People need face to face interaction. Without it they lack a feeling of community and connectedness. I don't believe the internet counts either. People need to get out, enjoy time with friends and family, experience things as a group, and meet new people.

Since we are wired for connection, it's really good for me to be with people. And it's VERY important for me to have time by myself. I work as a therapist and I have lovely friends, but that's a lot of interacting with people, so it's nice to have a break. It also makes me feel more empowered and confident when I am able to be alone and find ways to take care of or entertain myself.

I personally enjoy time alone. I am constantly around people, so being able to relax and reflect on events in your life is surprisingly pleasant. 
It's also a great opportunity to do nothing, which is also soothing in a way.

I think being alone can be a positive experience in moderation but for me it is a negative experience overall. I enjoyed it for a while, but then I stopped going outside and started spending most of my time indoors behind a screen and I stopped experiencing life as much as much as I needed to. After being alone for too long, a few years for example, it feels like time stops for yourself but continues for the rest of the world and you're just watching as your life is on pause. Days become repetitive and as such it can be hard to find meaningful moments. In the short term, being alone may be a positive experience. However, in the long term, being alone is a negative experience.

I enjoy being alone and I seem to require more alone time than the average person does to feel content. I've even described myself as asocial, though the level that this word applies to me varies through time and other factors. I find interacting with other people to have at least a noticeable base level of stress even if they are people that I like and even if the interaction only lasts a few seconds. I also find that quite often the stress or annoyance of an interaction was not worth the positive rewards of the interaction. I very rarely can be myself or truly relax around others, so all of these factors contribute to alone time being more enjoyable. However, this does come with a level of loneliness.

I enjoy time alone. I can listen to or watch whatever I want, spend time reading or playing guitar or working on projects that I like to pursue. I also use time alone to reflect on things in my life, it's kind of a struggle these days. I can cry if I'm upset. I can spend time with God and explore my spirituality. I've spent a lot of time surrounded by people over the past year and a half to the point where I would desperately need some space. Now I don't take time alone for granted, laying around. I almost always have something I can do.

I think being alone sometimes is a good thing. Everyone should have some time with friends and family and this close to them and also some time alone. Different people prefer different percentages of these two things!
For me time alone helps me to think about things and myself.Do not won’t to be this way a lot but I think a lot of people need time to reflect and is good for the soul.

I personally prefer being alone quite frequently. I find social interaction can be somewhat draining. I like to do a lot of quite, thoughtful activities. I, however, do like to spend time with my son and certain close friends. I also have a job that requires me to be around people all day, so I am not alone all of the time by any means. I think being around people at work makes my time alone very valuable to me. I need that time to decompress and relax. I do recognize that being alone too much can be unhealthy for me, so  I make an effort to spend some time each week socializing - I just think it is less than a lot of other people. I am okay with this.

I think being alone is a positive thing. It's good to be alone to decompress and not have to worry about doing things for others. It gives you a chance to do what you want to do and not have to put on a brave face in front of others. I prefer to be alone because I don't like having to go out in public and pretend to be a member of society where you have to act a certain way or say the right things. I don't have to smile just to smile to appear pleasant.

Spending time alone allows me to disengage from the chaos of the world, and from other peoples' expectations of me vis a vis their own situations. It allows me to work from home in peace, to do chores at my own pace, to set aside plenty of time for Bible study and prayer, and to chill out and appreciate all of the blessings which God has brought into my life. It's always a huge emotional relief to finish tasks outside my home, and to come back to a clean, quiet, safe, nurturing environment. It grounds me to spend time alone, and my life is so much the better for it.

I think being alone is a positive experience sometimes and then there are other times where is a sad or lonely experience. I personally think how it feels depends on where are you are in your life and what you want. For instance recently I have been trying to heal my mental health and I appreciate being able to be aloneMore often. I still want people to be around me and I want to be able to contact my love ones when I need to. But I enjoyed being in my bedroom chilling reflecting on things and healing

Most of the time I prefer to be alone, unless in the company of a beautiful and intelligent woman. Whether being alone or with people depends on the people involved in the equation. I am particular with whom I associate with, and I am definitely not a socialite. If the company had the same interests with me and they were good and moral people, then I would be more willing to "hang out".

Spending time alone is definitely a positive experience for me. I sometimes feel overwhelmed or more anxious when I'm around people for long periods of time without a break. Being alone means recharging, relaxing, and enjoying my time. I can be around people, but after a while, I need some time by myself as kind of life a reset. It's how I recharge my batteries, so to speak, because being around people is draining a lot of the time.
I enjoy spending time alone. It gives me time to reflect and think. I come up with most of the solutions to my problems when I am alone.
Spending time alone is a peaceful thing for me. I like being able to get away from people and do things by myself that I enjoy doing. I find comfort in thinking by myself and spending time alone

Time alone is a double edged sword, both happy and sad.  There are truly days that I adore the peace and solitude of being alone and there are times it can be very boring. Spending time alone is a 60% positive and 40% negative for me.
Negative because it just leads to boredom. I'm an introvert but I'm most happiest when I'm with close relationships. Spending alone time is great but it gets lonely

To me, spending time alone is a very positive experience. It allows me to relax and wind down after a long day. I can also do certain hobbies that are personal to me. At the same time, however, too much time alone can also be a negative experience for me. If I have days, where I spend most of my time alone, I start to feel lonely and sad.

I love spending time alone because I don't get a lot of opportunities to do it. I spend good portions of my days with many other people so when I have time to myself I really savor it and enjoy it to the fullest.

I do not mind spending time alone because I can better enjoy things to myself.  I do not like having people around as they tend to get in the way and cause trouble.  Alone time allows me to recharge and reflect.

I actually don’t like being alone, I mean I know I will be fine and I know it’s just a personal preference but every since I was young and my mom left me alone alot cause she was a single parent and she worked a lot plus she went to the bar a lot and I was just left to fend for myself and that has stuck with me into adulthood. I have anxiety and panic disorder and I get racing thoughts when I’m alone and I just don’t like it at all.

As an introvert, I enjoy spending time alone, participating in solo activities such as reading, gardening, listening to podcasts, going on walks, etc. For some activities, such as those spent outside in nature, being alone enables me to focus on my surroundings and be in the moment. I also struggle with social anxiety, so being alone lets me just focus on whatever I am doing instead of worrying if I am doing or saying the wrong thing. There is a point, however, when time spent alone becomes too much and I start feeling lonely, isolated, and disconnected. I do need some social time and time spent with my partner and other loved ones for my own well-being. It's a natural part of being human, to need human connection.

I think spending time alone is positive because I am an introvert and find people draining. On the other hand it may be negative because I don't tend to my social connections and Ive heard that is bad for your mental health in the long run.

Spending time alone is both negative and positive; it's not just one-sided. I am on disability and single so I spend most every day alone. The positive sides is that it's quiet and peaceful, no arguing, I can do what I want and it gives me time to focus on me for self improvement and healthful stress-free days most of the time. However, there are times where I do get seriously bored, lonely and maybe even down for all the isolation.

I definitely believe that alone time is a positive experience for me. I get to recharge by doing whatever I want without having to include anyone else in my decisions (usually, this means I take a nice, long nap).

Spending time alone is good for everyone. It's only a negative thing if it goes on for an extended duration of time, against your will. Otherwise it's good for your mental health to take some time to yourself once in a while.

I have always leaned more towards introversion so having alone time is essentially necessary for my happiness. That being said, I also struggle with social anxiety so throughout my life I've had to learn to unravel the desire to be alone from the tendency to seek isolation when I'm struggling mentally. Still, I wholeheartedly believe that not just myself, but every person should seek to find methods on how to use their alone time in positive ways as being alone is unavoidable. For example, during COVID most people spent time quarantined in their homes, often with little contact with others. It's undeniable the pandemic was catastrophic, but I think that in essentially being forced to be alone many people found ways to use that time investing in themselves. Personally, I was able to learn new hobbies and had the time to focus on improving my mental health through meditation and journaling. I did struggle with feeling isolated at times, but once the world re-opened and I adjusted to interacting with people again I found myself having healthier relationships with others by having built a healthier relationship with myself through spending so much time alone.
I think that being alone allows me to really escape the world of other people and society's constraints and truly allow myself to be free.

I really enjoy spending time alone in the peace and quiet. My family can be loud and I enjoy getting away from the craziness. I love to read, listen to a podcast or audio book, and do needlepoint. I like walking alone and listening to something. I even like driving alone in my car.

To me, spending time alone is a positive experience. At first, I thought of it as a negative experience, but when COVID came around I found that being alone is a very enjoyable experience for me. I don't view social interaction as something I must do. Of course, there are times when I get bored by myself, but I don't feel lonely.

I enjoy being alone sometimes because I have spent my entire life with others always around.  My fmily was large and the family I started was always full of kids and their friends.   So when I can escape from the world for a few hours, I really enjoy the peaceful time.

Spending time alone is a positive for me because I'm a stay-at-home-mom (SAHM) and I never get time for/by myself. I need that quiet time to reset my brain and just not think about anything for a little while. My days are consumed by daycare and school and appointments and lunches and extracurricular activities, and that's just for the kids! I also manage the household and do all of the cooking and cleaning, in addition to my own frequent doctor appointments. I NEED that alone time so I don't burn out.

On one hand I think spending time alone is great and on the other hand I think it is lonely and boring.  It really all depends on the day/week that I had. When the times are crazy and hectic then being alone is very enjoyable and I can get done the things that I haven't had time for. When I've been sad, being alone isn't always best because I am alone with the thoughts and feelings in my head.

exclude_reason: Took longer than 3 SDs above mean on completion
BeliefsTimeAloneOpen: Spending time alone can be a very good thing as long as it's not done too often. It provides an opportunity to think and understand yourself without the interruption of others. You can also work more efficiently on solo projects alone.

Spending time alone is very relaxing for me. I get to anything I please in a quiet environment. I can go long periods being alone and just being completely entertained and fulfilled. I enjoy the time I have to myself with a good book or even a video game. I get to do anything I please with no breaks or interruptions.

It does not bother me to be alone.  I can spend a lot of time alone and it doesn't bother me at all.  However, I appreciate that social interaction is healthy.  Sometimes I force myself to be social because I know it's healthy.

Everyone needs privacy and alone time, including myself. However, I generally thrive from being around people, so being alone is often a negative experience for me. I’m an extrovert that talks a lot/gets energy from being around others, so being alone for long periods of time leads to boredom, loneliness, etc.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me because I feel like I can truly relax. No one is watching me, or expecting anything from me, and I can do/act however I want without thinking of the repercussions or being judged for it. Also, a lot of my hobbies are also solitary hobbies, so when I am alone I get to do things like read, write, nap, and listen to music.

As someone who opts to spend more time alone than with others, I feel that there are grand benefits that can be received from spending time alone but there are also some pitfalls to look out for. When alone there's lots of time for introspection and to ensure that your own personal goals are the focal point of your efforts.  It allows you to be more grounded and have a better understanding of self. With that being said not every circumstance of being alone is voluntary.  For those who would like to have companionship it can be a detriment to be alone as those same benefits can be a curse.

I think that spending time alone can be either positive or negative depending on the circumstances. If you have spend a day surrounded by lots of other people, being alone can be wonderful. On the other hand, if you wish you were around other people, but aren't, it can be a negative experience.

Alone is usually me and my dogs. I find much enjoyment having nobody to answer to and arrange my life around. I enjoy sitting and doing nothing if that is what I want. I enjoy eating what and when I want. I enjoy not having to talk to people I find annoying (which are most people.) Generally, I like being alone. I do feel lonely on occasion, but not very often.
Being alone is simply being alone. It is a part of life and I generally do not give it much thought. I do rather enjoy my alone time. There is nothing negative about being alone.

I think spending time alone can be both positive and negative for me. On the one hand, I enjoy having time to myself to relax and recharge. I can do things that I enjoy, such as reading, writing, or listening to music. I can also reflect on my thoughts and feelings without feeling pressure to interact with others.

On the other hand, I can also feel lonely or isolated when I am alone for too long. I miss the company of others and the feeling of being connected. I can also start to overthink things and get stressed out.

Ultimately, whether spending time alone is a positive or negative experience for me depends on a number of factors, such as how much time I have spent alone, my mood, and my overall mental health. If I am feeling stressed or anxious, then spending time alone can make me feel worse. However, if I am feeling relaxed and content, then spending time alone can be a very enjoyable experience.
I think being alone is fine, but I prefer to be doing something useful. Long bike rides or runs, or researching or learning something new are some things that I enjoy doing alone.

It's a positive because you can focus, work on yourself, do whatever you want, and be fully engaged and thoughtful to others.  You can concentrate and not be interrupted.  

It's a negative because being alone for too long makes one lonely.

When I have time alone, I am feeling positive about it.  There is peace and quiet in my home and no one is yelling or fighting with one another. When I am alone, I get a lot of my daily housework completed because I don't have distractions from the kids or animals.

Being alone gives me time to plan my day and week.  It provides me time to read in peace and be able to think about and comprehend what I am reading.  When I am alone I just enjoy the peace and quiet.  It is a positive time for me generally.  It is like a deep cleansing breath.  After the time alone, I am ready to go on with the day and the things it will bring.

With putting up with customers all day, I find being alone is rewarding and peaceful. A small nap works wonders.  also my kitty is always there for me.

I also like to cook by myself.  But there are times when I enjoy dining out,

Then after a good nights rest, I am ready for a new day.

I enjoy time spent alone, it's a place where I could enjoy myself away from others and without judgement from the world. I enjoy making art, listening to music and playing games by myself and it's just a place I can relax and destress.
Being alone is a positive experience, I get to do whatever I want and I don't have to worry about people or anyone.

I find that spending time alone is lonely. I've always lived with somebody up until the last year and I am still getting use to living alone. I find that loneliness tends to hit me more on the weekends and at night. I miss having somebody readily to talk to and to watch shows or movies with. I find being alone leads me to overthink things and to reflect more on sad events of my life. I miss sharing just the little aspects of life with somebody.

Well... I'm autistic. I'm not sure if that will affect your data but I just wanted to say that before continuing. 
Being alone is the only way I can re-charge, regulate my body glitches, and process large amounts of data without being interrupted or overstimulated. 
Being alone gives me time to think and space to be able to un-mask without fear of being socially outcast or made fun of. 
Being alone is the only time I truly feel free and unrestricted from culture and social expectations and demands because neurotypicals genuinely don't understand there are a thousand ways to do something "Correctly" they only want a mimic of what they do to feel "safe". Anything outside of the "Mimic" (mask) will be met with disgust and possibly violence. 
When I am alone I know no one will hurt me or try to change me in some way to make me more palatable. I don't have to worry about missing social cues, body language, specific wordings (neurotypicals will say one thing and mean something else, it's extremely confusing and can be observed with fighting, flirting, or even casual conversation) so I understand what is actually being said, overstimulation from being near a heavy eclectic using building and hearing the energy discharge when its being used, and accidently hearing conversations I shouldn't. 
I think it's a positive experience because I am able to be wholly me without backlash or being observed and commented on like a wild animal.

Everyone needs some alone time every now and then. I think it is a positive experience. If I was never alone, I think I'd for crazy. If someone can not stand being alone, they have issues. Being able to be alone is healthy. I don't mean non-stop, but every now and then is a normal part of the human experience. Some of my most memorable experiences are times when I was alone. Sometimes doing things alone is beneficial. Enjoying things like sporting events, going to a theater, or even out to eat are all things that can be done alone, but for some reason many won't do it. I don't get that.

For me, being alone so far has very positive effects.  I am in a situation where it is not good to have people around because negative people and forces are working against me.  I cannot seem to be rid of these things, so this is the way to preserve my peace, quiet, and joy.   No having to hear lies, insults, answering questions that others already know the answers to, or having to share space with someone collaborating with others behind my back.   I have  lots I can do to keep me as busy as I want to be, that don't require the presence of another, anyway.  So until and if this  changes, this is the preferred way.

I like spending time with myself. It gives me an opportunity to do things without having any set time limit or obligations later. I'm allowed to do all the silly stuff I think about without worrying what others may think.

Although I enjoy and look forward to being with other people that I am close to, I really need some time alone every day. When I am alone I am able to explore my own thoughts without feeling a need to entertain anyone else.
Being alone is easier than it used to be because technology has given me the ability to reach out to others whenever we wish, even when I am alone. I don't always do that, but I have that option when I have had enough of alone time.
I'm as single dad with split custody of my child. I have a lot of alone time, and i do enjoy it, but it makes things hard sometimes.

I believe that any person can benefit from spending time alone. This is particularly true if this time is spent in reflection. Being alone can encourage personal growth and awareness. The benefits are all there if one wishes to see. Unfortunately, many people have difficulty being alone.
I enjoy the silence. I enjoy reading and learning without outside interruptions. I like it.

I think spending time alone can be both positive and negative for me.

On the one hand, I enjoy having time to myself to relax and recharge. I can do things that I enjoy, such as reading, writing, or listening to music. I can also reflect on my thoughts and feelings without feeling the need to censor myself. This can be a very helpful way to de-stress and improve my mental health.

On the other hand, I can also feel lonely and isolated when I spend too much time alone. I miss interacting with other people and feeling connected to the world.

Ultimately, I think the extent to which spending time alone is positive or negative for me depends on my mood, my current situation, and the activities that I am doing. If I am feeling stressed or overwhelmed, then I need some time alone to decompress. However, if I am feeling lonely or isolated, then I need to make an effort to connect with other people.

I think that alone is generally a more positive experience than not for me. I am often depleted emotionally after work or social interactions, and I appreciate the time to metaphorically re-charge my batteries. I also like to have time where I can do things that I enjoy doing without having to worry about what someone else wants. All in all, I find being alone to be a pleasurable experience.
Spending time alone I think is beneficial to our true selves.  I feel we need to be comfortable being alone to really make the best out of our lives.
I think being alone can be a good time to reflect, relax and recharge but can also be boring at times.

I spend almost all my time alone. I drive for work and live by myself with my son. I was an only child growing up and being alone is something I have always kinda done. The older I get I realize that personal interactions are important tho and to much alone time can be bad

I think it’s beneficial to be able to sit with yourself without always being “on” or “performative” for another person. It’s nice to be able to fully focus on yourself and know how you feel about things.
I enjoy being around my friends and family, and while I do enjoy alone time I tend to get extremely in my head and bored so I'd rather spend most of my time with a small group.

For many individuals, spending time alone can be a multi-faceted experience. Some might find it to be a positive and enriching time for self-reflection, relaxation, and pursuing personal interests. This solitary time can offer a break from the demands of social interactions, allowing individuals to recharge and focus on their thoughts or hobbies.

On the other hand, some people might perceive spending time alone as negative due to feelings of loneliness, isolation, or boredom. For them, solitude might amplify negative thoughts and lead to a sense of disconnection from others. The absence of social interactions can sometimes contribute to a sense of missing out or longing for human connection.

Ultimately, how one perceives time alone can be influenced by their personality, circumstances, and mindset. It's important to note that the way individuals view solitude can evolve over time and in different situations. Finding a balance between spending time alone and engaging in social interactions is key to maintaining emotional well-being

I think spending time alone can be both positive and negative. It is highly dependent on circumstances that surround the time when I am alone. I find that when I am doing work on my computer, and getting things done that it can be a positive experience. The same goes for when I am reading a book or enjoying a movie. However, when I am feeling depressed, or having a bad day sometimes it can be negative.
i like being left alone. i can do what i want and work on things that are important to me.

For me it is generally a positive experience.  I'm a father of three and have always been very introverted.  Time alone is time when my social battery can recharge.  In the past I've enjoyed traveling a lone as well.
I like to have some time to myself each day.  I need that time to recharge.

To me spending time alone is not only a pleasant experience, but also a must. For me being around people takes so much effort emotionally and mentally that at the end of the day I **need** to spend time alone to de-stress and relax. I value time alone, I crave it. It helps me to think and to center my emotions and to be what is 'normal' for me.

Spending time alone is a deeply cherished and positive experience for me. This time allows me to set the pace, prioritize my needs, and cultivate a stronger sense of independence. Ultimately, embracing solitude enhances my well-being, offering a chance to connect with myself on a profound level and encouraging personal growth.

Being by myself is actually pretty great for me, especially at 36. Life's gotten super busy with working on things, family stuff, and all. So, those times I get to be alone are like a breath of fresh air.

I like being alone because it helps me figure things out about myself. Life can get so crazy that I sometimes lose track of what I want and how I feel. Being alone lets me think about that stuff and get back in touch with myself.

Plus, I can do things I really enjoy when I'm alone. Like reading, listening to music, or just working on my own projects. No one's rushing me, and it feels good to have that freedom.

Being alone also gives me a break from all the noise of phones, social media, and talking to people. It's like hitting a pause button on all that chaos. This quiet time helps me think better, plan stuff, and even come up with cool ideas I might not think of when things are crazy.

But, of course, I also like being around people. Too much alone time can make me feel lonely, and that's not fun. So, finding the right balance is important.

All in all, being alone is like a way to recharge and focus on myself. It's not about shutting out the world, but more like taking a breather and getting ready to handle whatever comes my way.

I don't mind being alone. I take that as time to enjoy pursuits and activities that don't need a group. I love reading and that is something I do when I am alone. It allows me to find some peace, relaxation and calm.

I am defiantly not a loner, but I think being alone from time to time helps a person gather themselves back together. I have a very busy family life, where I am torn in many different ways. I will tell my family that I've reach the point were I need to be alone for a few hour to reconnect with myself. It takes many different form. A walk in the park, shopping, meditating, sometimes even a drive to nowhere while listing to a book. I have never lived alone though, and when I think about the prospect it makes me sad, so I understand why people find the prospect negative.

Being alone is a positive experience, allowing me to learn more about myself and my thoughts, feelings, and actions. It can also be a negative experience, causing me to be isolated from friends and others.
I prefer being alone because its just more peaceful. There's not emotions no drama and honestly just lets me better connect with myself

I love spending time alone, to be with my own thoughts, do what I want without needing to concern myself (as much) with what others expect of me, or what they want to do. I have a number of hobbies that are conducive to alone time, from creative writing to knitting and sewing, and listening to music, to watching videos or even particular movies that my spouse doesn't like so much. I also like to spend time thinking things through, planning projects, or just sitting outside and enjoying the sounds of nature around me. There's never a dull moment for me, during alone time, whereas when I have to take what someone else wants into consideration, sometimes I'm bored when with others. Being with people also drains me emotionally and physically, so alone time allows me to revive and restore myself, to regain my balance. Even if I have to do work not of my choosing during alone time, I find that I'm better able to focus and get into a flow. The work goes more quickly without interruptions or distractions.
It is very harmful stay alone. I strongly disagree with it. Human needs partner for living. No one can live alone.

I think having some time alone is good. You get a break from the chaos and can be alone with your thoughts. It’s relaxing and whatever you have to do can be done on your schedule. You can also do what you want and not be judged by others.
I can do what I want, when I want.  Being with people is complex to me.

I do not mind being alone at all. At this point in my life I would rather be alone than with people. I have had a very rough couple of years and I just rather be alone. So being alone for me is positive.
I think it depends on how I am feeling emotionally. Some times when I am alone I feel at peace and can breath a little bit. Other times I do feel lonely and sad when alone.

Well I think being alone for me is a positive in my current health state.  By being alone i mean I don't have to take care of a wife or girlfriend because I can barely take care of myself.  Being alone also helps me concentrate on me, don't have to worry about getting into potential arguments etc.   Its a negative because sometimes I really do just feel alone.

I love spending time alone. It lets me tap into my creative side.  Art expression is important to me and having uninterrupted time to do that is a necessity to my happiness.
I also think things through in my head and it gives me a chance to think about friends and loved ones. In my mind I may go over conversations we last had. There is so much we say, but unless we listen between the lines and pay attention to body language - there is so much we miss.

Being alone is normally a positive experience for me, as I value the time for introspection. 
I can choose to listen to music, or enjoy the peaceful quiet. I have always been able to occupy myself when alone, do not feel that being alone is a negative thing. I am comfortable with myself, I'm comfortable with others also, and value time spent with others. I do not feel that I am missing out on anything if I happen to be on my own, however.
I like to live alone. I feel freedom when I live alone. I have personal space and willingness to do what I want to do.

In my opinion, I think spending time alone is a positive thing. Being alone gives you time to reflect on and think about different aspects of yourself and your life. Being aline can be an enjoyable experience. You can use this time to pamper yourself by taking a hot bubble bath, watch a good movie, read a good book, etc. I look at being alone as a peaceful time. Spending time alone is an essential experience for me, as other people exhaust me very easily. I am not the most gregarious or outgoing person, so social interactions are more difficult for me than most other people. I think of being alone as a good time to decompress and collect my thoughts. Also, most of the activities I participate in tend to be solitary, such as hiking, reading, gaming, and browsing the internet. I feel as if I should be more social, but I no longer have many outlets for meeting or reaching out to others.

I lived and studied at the university level in another country as a U.S. citizen for 5 years and I learned how to enjoy spending time by myself during that time because I only had my friends from school, but everyone lived separately and I didn't have any family near me. It was a time where I learned how to truly enjoy being with myself and my thoughts and it was very healthy. I grew so much as a person and truly learned what made me happy, like reading, watching movies, hobbies like knitting and painting and picking up a textbook and really learning a subject because I did not have any outside distractions of being surrounded by people and their problems. I had more free time for myself. My friends tend to look for advice from me and emotionally dump their problems on me and I find it draining some times. I did not have to deal with that emotional baggage during that time in my life. 

That time living abroad forced me to really be with my thoughts and I gained a lot of clarity about who I was as a person, my own personal goals, and what made me happy without outside influences. I have learned how to live freely without external validation from others and that has been the healthiest and most freeing experience. The person I was when I first moved to live abroad was not the same person who returned back to the United States. I was emotionally better, stronger and more prepared to deal life's curveballs that came my way, than I would have been had I not spent time alone.  

When I moved back to the states, I was able to pinpoint people(family and friends) who were emotional vampires and really set boundaries with them to maintain the same level of happiness and emotional health that I had living away from them during my time in school. Spending time alone allows a human being to recharge and really center themselves. It also gives clarity and more appreciation for friends, family and social interactions and to truly be present and enjoy that time spent with others.

I think spending time alone at least every once in a while is needed. I sped time alone when I meditate or when I want to think about the things I need to do. I also like spending time alone when I go to a museum so I can take my time to see what I want to see. I don't like spending time alone for long periods of time because I start feeling lonely without anyone I can talk to or spend time with.
I enjoy having alone time in my life but after a point it becomes depressing. I would prefer to have less alone time.
I think people should learn to be alone because if you don't you might invite the wrong person into your life and tolerate disrespect just because you don't want to be alone.

I fully enjoy spending time alone away from the overwhelming tumult of other people. Therefore, I value any time I can get for myself to the extent that I can happily spend months with scarcely any social contact, as such contact is unavoidable in this age. But for the requirement of working and other such forced contact, I could spend a very long time without the company of people.

I love being alone for the simple fact that I have privacy. I can do whatever I want, and no one is watching. That means there is no judgement, and no one is going to know what I am doing. I enjoy spending time alone each day, as long as it's not all day. It's a positive experience because I like to have the quiet time. I enjoy time to myself alone.  I feel like it gives me time to reflect and collect my thoughts.  I talk a lot at work so it's nice sitting back and relaxing not having to talk to someone.  I can watch my tv shows or just listen to the music I like. It's nice not having someone ask me questions or needing me something to do because I am the only one around.  I can entertain myself very well.

I think being alone is a positive experience because you can find out who you are as a person overall. Most of my life has not been spent alone. However, about 5 years ago, I went through a divorce. My two adult children moved out, and I found myself alone. I absolutely love having my own space, cleaning up after ONLY myself, doing what I want, when I want and how I want, watching the TV shows I want to watch, making meals for myself and foods I like to eat. I LOVE being alone.

Being alone is good for my own mental, physical, and spiritual health. I believe it gives me time to decompress, wind down, and release the stresses of the day. It's great for meditation, reflection, and prayer. I also believe being alone is good for my relationships with people because when you spend too much with each other you can start to get on each other's nerves

Being alone is very productive thus this makes it a positive. When I'm alone, I'm free to be alone with my thoughts without having to deal with any interference from others. When I'm home alone, I'm free to listen to music of my choosing anywhere in the house, as loud as I want, and any time of the day I choose to do so. I can also work on a variety of household products amd work on the projects long into the night. For example, a few years ago, I attempted to "Marie Kondo" my house. I pulled out everything in all of my closets making huge piles in most every room. I often would work into the wee hours of the night not having to worry about disturbing any one.Being alone doesn't bother me at all and helps me to be much more productive.

I love being alone, I make time for myself and spend several hours alone each day.  I like being alone with my thoughts and being without any interruptions. On the other side I do have time for my wife.  We spend time together each day and it is important for both of us to do so.  There is a balance to being alone and with someone that needs to be met.

It can be positive at times. There are times when you might want to be alone and think. At times, you want to partake in your favorite hobby or interest by yourself. IT can be good. I do think too much time alone is bad though. I feel that human companionship is one of the most beautiful things in our lives. Spending time with those we love and care for is important.

I enjoy alone time because it gives me a chance to think about things I have on my mind. Often, things will happen during the day that interests me in a way that makes me want to think more about them.

Being by yourself can promote self-reflection, personal development, and stress reduction. Independence, self-assurance, and a sense of fulfillment are fostered by solitude, which frees people to relax and partake in their favorite hobbies. However, depending on personal preferences and environmental factors, it has different effects.

Spending time alone is a multifaceted experience for me, encompassing both positive and negative aspects depending on the context and my emotional state. There are moments when being alone offers a precious opportunity for introspection, self-discovery, and recharge. During such times, I find solace in the tranquility, allowing me to delve into my thoughts, interests, and creative pursuits. This solitude often serves as a mental sanctuary where I can unwind, free from external distractions and societal expectations.

On the other hand, there are instances when being alone can trigger feelings of isolation, especially when it's not a choice but a result of circumstances. During these moments, solitude can evoke a sense of longing for connection and companionship, leading to feelings of sadness or even loneliness. The absence of social interaction may amplify negative thoughts and accentuate any existing emotional challenges.

In essence, my perception of spending time alone fluctuates based on the quality of my solitude and my emotional well-being. When I engage in activities I'm passionate about or embrace moments of mindful solitude, being alone becomes a cherished and affirmative experience. Conversely, when isolation stems from a lack of choice or triggers feelings of detachment, it can be tinged with negativity. Thus, my outlook on spending time alone is a delicate interplay between the opportunity for self-growth and the potential for emotional vulnerability, ultimately shaping my overall perspective on this aspect of life.
spending time alone is good for me. it allows me to think about issues im facing. also i get anxiety when around people so it helps keep me calm.

As an introvert, spending time alone is a positive experience that allows me to replenish my energy and escape life's daily stresses. I find that spending time alone can be a positive, refreshing, and necessary experience for me, particularly in the context of a busy and demanding life. There is a certain freedom that comes with having the time and space to think and reflect without the distractions of others. It allows me to prioritize my thoughts and goals, and to step back from the demands of daily life.

Spending time alone can also be a time for personal growth and development. Being alone allows me to delve deep into my thoughts and emotions, to face my vulnerabilities and fears, and to come to terms with my values and beliefs. I believe that this internal work helps me to become a more authentic and self-aware person, which in turn leads to richer relationships and greater fulfillment in my life.

Also, time alone can be a time for creativity and exploration. A sense of solitude encourages me to think outside the box and to try new things without the pressure or judgment of others. It allows me to tap into my imagination and to pursue my passions and interests.

It can help clear your head and help you experience/understand what has been going on and give you some time to reflect. It can be negative if you are alone for too long in the sense that it can be isolating and you miss out on new experiences.

Spending time alone is a concept that holds a multifaceted significance for me. There are instances when being alone is a truly rejuvenating and positive experience. During these moments, I relish the tranquility that solitude offers. It's an opportunity to engage in activities that I am passionate about, without any external distractions. Whether it's reading a book, practicing a hobby, or simply enjoying a peaceful walk, being alone can be a refreshing break from the hustle and bustle of daily life.

Also, there are also times when spending time alone can take a more negative turn. It can evoke feelings of isolation and loneliness, particularly when I'm yearning for companionship or missing the presence of loved ones. During such moments, solitude might amplify my thoughts and emotions, leading to overthinking or a sense of disconnectedness.

My perspective on spending time alone is a delicate balance between the positive and negative aspects. It's a chance to self-reflect, gather my thoughts, and engage in activities that bring me joy. Yet, I also recognise the importance of social interactions and the potential for feelings of loneliness. In essence, my feelings about being alone are shaped by the context, my emotional state, and the specific activities I engage in during those solitary moments.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me because I am introverted and enjoy this alone time.  I have many solitary hobbies (art, reading, walking, etc.) so I rarely feel bored alone.  When I am alone is when I am able to relax the most and feel like myself.  As long as I balance it with hanging out with other people as well, spending time alone is a positive and healthy experience.

I think it used to be a completely negative experience for me. When I was younger,  I dealt with severe anxiety, depression, intrusive thoughts, OCD, separation anxiety, etc., so being alone with myself and my thoughts made everything seem so much worse. When I was with my family or friends, I felt like my mind was taken off of things, I had someone who could support and encourage me, and I felt more at ease. I struggled immensely when I went to college and was in my dorm alone all afternoon and evening. 
Things have changed a little bit since I have had children. I have 3 kids, ages 6 and under. Since having my children, I find incredible value in the limited alone time I have. Since it is so rare for me to ever be alone, when I get a day - or even just an hour - to do what I want to do, it is so refreshing for me. If I had to be alone for an extended period of time, it would still be negative, though, because that would mean that something was wrong or something happened because I wouldn't be with my husband and children, who bring me so much joy.

Spending time alone is extremely important for me. I absolute need to "recharge my social battery" for a few minutes to a few hours each day. I like to be disconnected from everything for a while each day, and I am generally inactive on social media. I genuienly enjoy being alone, it very rarely gets boring for me.

If being alone is part of a balance existence then it is healthy and rewarding for me personally. I enjoy the chance to indulge myself, I can work, research, clean the kitchen, stare at a wall or whatever I please to do. I can recharge myself. The absence of noise and demands and requests and questions and obligations is is the reward. But I stress, everything in balance is the key.

Sometimes it can be a good thing, like wanting to reflect after a rough day of work. Of course the context also matters, and silence just be just as easily a bad time. I find loneliness to be exemplified during periods of grief or extreme sorrow as well.

I am someone who finds being alone enjoyable most of the time. I am definitely someone who enjoys being around others as well, but I love my alone time. It is a positive experience for me because I like to do things by myself that bring me joy and being alone helps me do a "reset" I often need after days of being around people.
I enjoy alone time where I can have privacy and time to relax without having to cater to anyone or hold space for them.

I thoroughly enjoy being alone. Yes, it gets lonely sometimes, but overall, I enjoy spending time alone. It allows me to have the autonomy to do what I want, when I want. However, there are moments when I miss spending time with him, talking to him about his day, having someone to say good morning and good night too and those are the moments when I get really lonely and I really hate being alone.  In those moments, i can get hyper-focused on being alone and how much I hate it.  I get the urge to reach out to my ex-boyfriend even though I know deep down that our relationship was really toxic.  I want to like being alone but I don't want to be so alone that I don't ever want to be around another person again.  I like having companionship.

Being alone is a positive experience for me. If my day is busy with activity and being out of the house for several hours, I relish the time to be alone at home and do what I want.
