My boyfriend doesn't infrequently go out and enjoy himself - often with his friends, and never invites me. This makes me really lonely. That said, when my boyfriend is home he needs a lot of attention and frequent validation. He is alternately very hyper and happy or very angry and raging. I love him very much but this is exhausting for me and my sensory issues from autism, and trauma issues from C-PTSD. So a little more often I'd lean toward being alone being more positive and healthy for myself, because it's the only time I get time for myself and to just relax.

I think being alone for a set time each day is important, as it helps you focus on yourself. By this, I mean think about what you experienced lately or during the day. It gives you time to relax and focus on what needs to be done. In conclusion, I would say this is a positive experience for the most part.

Being alone for a day could evoke a mix of emotions within me. On one hand, I might welcome the opportunity to have uninterrupted time to engage in activities that I truly enjoy. I could use the time to read, write, reflect, or pursue hobbies that I often don't get a chance to fully immerse myself in. This sense of freedom and autonomy might bring a feeling of contentment and peace.

I think spending time alone is a very good thing for me.  It's time to do what I want, watch what I want and just be me.  I don't have to do anything any one says I can just enjoy the peace and quiet if I want.
Spending time alone is a positive experience for me because it allows me to connect with myself, my own thoughts and feelings, and focus on the things I care about most.

I find that it depends on the situation whether I find being alone a positive or negative experience.  When I need some alone or individual time, I find being alone a relaxing and positive experience.  But when I crave social interaction, it is sad spending that time alone.

I think having sufficient alone time is absolutely necessary for me.  There is a limit to how much time I can spend around others without needing a break.  That said, there is such a thing as too much alone time, and after a certain period of time I will get lonely.  However, I prefer the majority of my day to be spent by myself if possible.
I like spending time alone because it makes you feel great about yourself. You can be very productive and get a lot of work done.

I think it is nice to have some time alone in order to accomplish what you need to get done without worrying about someone else distracting you or having to attend to their needs.  I think everyone needs some time alone to gather their thoughts and to recharge and think in a calm environment.
It lets you relax, focus on yourself. I find it healthy as well.  Less distractions from other people.

I think it's very important to spend time alone. People need to get to know themselves and what they truly think and feel. Often people are so busy and don't have time to connect to themselves and I think that's bad.

It's normally positive because of balance. I go to work, deal with people and socialize. Come home, usually play games with friends or chat online too. The alone periods are just my 'me' time. I unwind, worry about nothing. Rather it's games, music, shows or just drawing. These things just let me shake off recent events, maintain my own mental health and then at other times get stuff done. Like yard work or housework. I think as long as you balance alone time with other time, it is a healthy experience everyone could use.
Spending time alone is a positive experience for me because I can concentrate on my hobbies that are relaxing. Sometimes dealing with other people's wants and needs becomes stressful.

It has always seemed to me that being alone is a standard default. My family never ate at the table and rarely all sat down together for any activity that wasn't tense or worrying. When you have that you learn to live with the expectation that you are the best you will have. I was ignored by them a lot. I am pretty sure they only married because it was expected and i am the same, they only had me just because. I have come to find a lot of peace in solitude. I can think clearly and pursue my own interests. I am not always alone, i have a wife and cats, but the time i have to myself is very important to me. Alone for too long is negative, but overall being alone is pretty good. Positive until you want to share what you know with others. The act of learning and absorbing new things are the best of solitude recently. Covid has also taught me to rely more on myself and see the strengths i wasnt aware of. When you are alone you need to grow strong.

Being alone is a positive experience, it allows you time to self reflect. Alone time gives you time to work on creative projects. Time alone also allows you time to read, study, meditate and other self care related activities.

I think spending time alone is a positive experience.  It allows me time to clear my thoughts and think about what I want to do with my time.  It lets me think about things that have happened and look back at them clear of any external influence.

For me, being alone is a positive experience. When I'm alone, I don't have to pay attention to whether or not I'm making eye contact, or saying the right thing at the right time. I won't be overwhelmed by constant noise from other people. I can be myself and partake in the activities I enjoy without being exhausted after. My hobbies can be completely solitary, and I can decide if I want to involve other people in them. My time alone is the only time I feel safe and secure.

I like spending time by myself. I can just relax and do what I want without anybody bothering me or needing my help with anything. I can choose to sit and a read a book, do outdoor or household chores, or enjoy watching some TV. I can whatever I want without having to worry about somebody else's ideas or plans.

I enjoy alone time, it allows me to refresh and get my thoughts together. Sometimes silence is bliss. When spending time alone you get a chance to listen to your inner thoughts and get your life in order.

Since I am introverted, I enjoy my time alone. It's a time where I can do whatever I want without feeling judged. Spending time alone is usually a positive experience for me because I'm more of an introverted person. I love spending time alone. It's the only time I can actually read a book or focus on what I'm doing at the moment.  I am  not much of a talker so it drives me insane when people talk constantly. My job entails working with dogs. So, even though I may be alone, it doesn't feel like I'm alone.
Spending time alone can be a positive experience as there are times when being alone to just think to yourself and get away from all the things going on in life is great.

I have severe social anxiety so spending time alone is preferable to me. Because of this, my world has grown smaller and smaller over the years, especially since I've retired. Because of my social anxiety issues, it's just easier to stay home and be alone with my cats.  At least I'm comfortable with them and being alone has just become part of my life and who I am. I think being alone is positive. It allows me to think deeply. I am able to be at peace with myself. I can also then enjoy moments with others more.

I think it is positive in the aspect that I get to enjoy my own company, and not have to worry about others. It can be negative if I start to enjoy my alone time way more than I do with others, it could become a problem.

I am somewhere between an introvert and extrovert. I have a very outgoing personality and love being around people, but at times, I really need to be alone so that I can recharge. spending time alone can be a bit of a mixed bag, I guess it really depends on the what kinda person you are. I think that being alone can be pretty great. I think being alone is a positive experience. It gives you time to interact with who you are, to wind down, to just relax or do a hobby that you enjoy. Taking time for yourself is essential in maintaining good mental health.

But being alone too much makes you self-centered, less likely to reach out to those in need, base your life on your own needs instead of other people that you care about. So really it can be both a negative and a positive. I choose to say that it's more of an in-between.
I think spending time alone is a positive thing for me. I enjoy to get to collect my thoughts and work on things I need to work on. I enjoy having time to myself.

To me it is a positive experience.  I need time alone to charge my batteries and to renew myself.  Being around people drains me, but I feel better if I can be alone and read, watch TV, draw or do any of the things that make me feel good.  I look forward to my time every day after I am done with everything and I can lie in bed alone.  It is my favorite time of the day.

I do like to be alone. It gives my mind time to think and analyze things. I can just sit there and think about my goals and things I need to do without being interrupted. When people are around, I have to be talking to them and keeping them entertained or interacting with them. There is no time for me really when I am with people. I try to please them and keep them happy instead. So it is sometimes better for me to be alone so I can take care of things I need to be peacefully without having to worry about pleasing others. When I am alone I can be quiet and do things that I want and need to do.
It's positive. Nice to reflect.

I believe that spending time is important to help a person recharge.  It can help you stay in touch with your thoughts and emotions.  I think it provides space to sort through problems.  I do find being alone for, too, long to be isolating at times.

For me, being alone is refreshing. I can think through things as I please, without needing to explain myself to anyone. I don't have to find an activity to do, I can just do whatever I want to do. I can find some quiet, and some peace when I'm by myself. It's nice to just have time to think and figure out the big questions in life.

I'm an introvert, so I'm very comfortable in my own company. Spending time with people is sometimes exhausting. Being alone is positive for me because I can do what I want when I want. I don't dislike people, but I prefer to spend most of my time by myself. I enjoy reading, thinking, and relaxing while listening to good music. All of these things are very positive and refill my cup when it starts to feel empty.

I think it is a positive experience for me. It allows me to recharge nad get back into something that I want to do later like go hang out with my friends. I like to focus on myself for a bit to be able to do those things and become more relaxed form it.
I do not mind spending time alone

I have Fibromyalgia, so spending time around people can be exhausting. I need the time away to recharge my batteries, so to speak. I don't really see being alone as a negative. I really need my alone time or I start to feel like I'm about to collapse.

I think it is a positive experience. I consider alone time to be time away from work and other responsibilities. I enjoy this time because I can dive into my personal interests without thinking or worrying about anything else.

I love being alone! I live in a house full of people. I live with my significant other, his mom, our child and some more of his family. When I get to spend time alone I am at peace. I can recharge my social meter, because being around people who are not my family leaves me drained sometimes. I can clean up the house completely! Omg I can listen to music loud and dance around freely. I can watch sad programs and cry without being bothered. I can take a nap if I want to. I rarely do but thats beside the case. I can throw their acuminated crap away without question! I can try to meditate, work out, write in my journal, work on my lap top, the list of things goes on and on. To sum things up, I love to spend time alone. It's great for my mental health.

There are times when I long to be with people, but most of my time is spent alone and I'm more or less ok with it. But only to a point. We're social creatures, even the most introverted. We all need time to unwind and contemplate in silence, but the rest of the day should be spent amongst other people, not "interfacing" via machines.

I think spending time alone can be a great and positive experience. You have time to dedicate yourself to your own needs, weather it's catching up on a show, a book, or investing time into one of your hobbies. You can sit in silence or listen to your favorite music, the time is yours. When I'm alone, I like to draw and get myself into the "flow', where I am completely focused on making art and nothing else.
I believe being alone is overall a positive experience. It is enjoyable, peaceful, and gives you time to just think and reflect.

It's both positive and negative depending on the person and how you see life.  There's benefits that help you along the way not being alone.  I think it's important to find the right balance between the two and to do what makes you happy by not following any negative social beliefs and standards. There is no right and wrong answers to this.  I believe being alone is much easier, much has to be processed be fore you take this route and your mental has to be very strong willed.  Bring people into your life with "balance" is the key to all will make you happy.

I think it's complicated. I definitely like having time away from people, pursuing my own interests and not having to, perform for others. Really relax not having to worry about saying or doing the wrong thing. At the same time though of course I enjoy and love other people and I start getting really depressed and despondent when I'm alone too much.

Spending time alone is a double edged sword for me, I am autistic and quite introverted, so the time alone feels necessary for me to thrive, however I also deal with various mental health issues that can make being alone quite difficult at times. Being alone with your thoughts can be simultaneously enriching and damaging, and it depends entirely on my frame of mind in that moment. It can shift quite quickly, and when it comes to introspection I can be quite volatile.

I think being alone is a overall positive experience for me. I don't mind being alone for some time, like a few hours. I can use that time to do what I need to do or want to do like watching a TV show no one else I know likes. It can also give me a chance to clear my head and relax.

After a while such as spending all or most of the day by myself, I start to feel like I had enough of being alone and want to spend some time with other people. If I were to spend days alone, that would be a little too much and would stress me out.

I thrive on being alone, not all the time, but it doesn't bother me to be alone for several hours. It gives my time to do my own things without worrying what others want to do. It allows my mind and body to just relax and wind down.

Being alone gives me time to think things over slowly and not just make impulsive decisions. When I am alone I can control the types of distractions that interrupt what I am doing. Alone time gives me time to be very creative and come up with new ideas in a less stressful way than if I had a lot of people around. I am usually very productive when I am alone and if problems arise then I am better equipped to handle things when I am calm and unstressed

Being alone is a great way to release stress. We are interacting with people on a regular basis. Sometimes we need alone time to know ourselves. It's a great way to re-evaluate our needs and wants. It's also a great break from everyone else. Sometimes being around people all the time is unhealthy. They are like energy vampire. There has to be some rest time and being alone can give you that. Especially if you go out to nature environment. Quiet time is quality time with self. It also can be negative if it's done too much. We are social beings and we need balance. No one can live without socializing.

Being alone is positive for me because it gives me a chance to slow down and reflect on things in my life. This is time that I need in order to stay sane. I would not be able to live very well if I was constantly around people, never alone.
I love to be alone. I am a quiet person, and I am easily annoyed. It’s not that I don’t like other people, I just want to be around them in limited doses.
I believe that spending time alone to yourself is a good thing it gives you time to think and clear your head. It is good to be around other people but not 100% of the time.

I love to have some time alone everyday. Luckily, my husband feels the same way.
Since we are both retired, we are together all the time, and even the most loving spouses needs some time alone. My husband loves to watch TV, I love to read but can't concentrate when the tv is on. For an hour everyday, my husband watches TV upstairs and I read downstairs. We each get to spend some time alone, and our marriage is all the stronger for it. I find the peace and quiet I get while reading calms me down, gives me peace and is enjoyable. My husband feels the same about his TV time. I have always enjoyed my own company and find it recharges me to be alone.

For me spending time alone is normal and it has a tendency to make me happy because I feel like I can re-charge. There are times however that I feel incredibly lonely and that no one cares about me when no one is reaching out to me. So to combat this I'm left to reach out to others, but that's fine as long as I don't fall into a depressive episode. Most of the time however I spend my alone time doing things that I love, focusing on myself, self-care.
I think it is a positive experience. It lets you work on yourself. It gives you time to think things through. It also give you peace and comfort.

For me being alone is a mostly positive experience. I enjoy solo hiking, spending time alone in nature and contemplating the world on my own. I also enjoy solitary past-times and hobbies like reading and woodworking to name a few. I'm quite content with my own company. I do enjoy my family and friends and enjoy the company of others too.

I find that spending time alone to me is very positive. It allows me time to reflect and gather my thoughts, as well as recharge after being around others. I'm very introverted, and I greatly value my "me time".  I feel refreshed and ready to tackle any problems that may come my way after being alone.

I get socially drained very quickly. I've always been more of an introvert, enjoying my own company more than others. I like to be by myself and read, play video games, write. I just feel better by myself.

Time alone, for me, is like a sanctuary where I can escape the demands of the external world and reconnect with my thoughts and feelings. It's a canvas on which I can paint my innermost musings, free from judgment or interruption.

The positive aspect of solitude lies in its ability to grant me a sense of peace and clarity. During these moments, I can dive deep into the realms of my imagination, indulge in hobbies that bring me joy, or simply revel in the quietude. There's a tranquility in being able to focus entirely on my thoughts, allowing ideas to flow and creativity to flourish without the distractions of social interactions.

On the other hand, there's an awareness that too much solitude can lead to a sense of isolation. While moments of introspection are cherished, an extended period of isolation might lead to a yearning for connection. The negative aspect of being alone is intricately tied to the potential for loneliness. The absence of shared experiences and the absence of conversations can sometimes evoke a pang of longing for companionship.

Alone time is important. It allows me to plan my day in a way that is most beneficial. It also gives me that all important time to unwind after a long day. I am more creative and peaceful if I have some alone time during my day. I find it to be positive for me.

I have my husband always here but I am always alone.  He has a slight disability, PD so it is hard to connect with im.  We've only been married 5 years so not a lot of history together.  I moved out of state for him so I ave no friends, don't speak to neighbors.  So I like to be truly alone so I can do what I want not the daily drudgery of what I need to  do to keep  us afloat.

I think that being alone, for me, is mostly a positive experience because I am an introvert and I can relax, rest, and recharge when I am alone. I also can focus and concentrate on work and other tasks and projects when I am alone and there are no distractions. However, I think it is important for me to spend time with others as well, because it's not good to be too isolated and cut off from others. We need human connection as well.

I think being alone is a net positive for me. I have a very rich internal life--I love thinking deeply about things that interest me, and love having opportunities to learn more about...really anything. I feel it helps me to better understand myself, the world, and my place in the world. I also enjoy being around people--particularly close family members and/or friends--but I find I have a limited ability to enjoy this on an ongoing basis.

Humans are inherently social beings, so being alone is negative to our mental health. For me, this holds true. When I'm alone, I long for conversation and some sort of human contact. I feel lonely, and I'm just lost in my thoughts. It makes me feel worse about myself, like people don't want to be around me - even though those thoughts are unfounded, they still creep into my mind. Also, in my experience, being along can reinforce some of your negative traits and thoughts; if you don't have someone to call you out or correct you, then you'll go on thinking what you're currently doing or thinking is okay. Social contact has a way of balancing us all out, and they helps society as a whole.

There are two great ingredients to happiness: silence and solitude.  It's easy to feel connected when posting and interacting with others on social media, but the reality is that too much "contact" can be overwhelming.  We take too little time to focus on ourselves, not in a solipsistic way, but just to figure out what it is we're thinking and feeling.

I live alone and work from home so I am alone quite often and very content. I do however get lonely at times and if so, I'll go out for a walk or bike ride to get fresh air and interact with people. I prefer being alone most of the time so that I can avoid conflict with others unless it's a positive occasion.

I think spending time alone is really positive and important for me. It gives me time to recharge and rest my mind. It allows me to enjoy what is present without feeling pressured to talk to others or engage with them. I can indulge my favorite hobbies like watching a film that I like, or bake a cake or just read a book in silence. It makes me feel good knowing I can take care of myself without needing anything from others.

It is a positive experience for me because social situations tend to be draining and being alone allows me to recharge. It also allows me to be more productive as I get distracted when trying to work or read around other people. I also find it generally easier to relax while alone so that time is peaceful for me.

I think spending time alone can be a really good thing. I love spending time with my wife but sometimes I just kind of want to be left alone. It's quiet, I'm not required to do anything I don't want to do and I can affect my environment however I want to. Sometimes I just like the peace and quiet of being myself. It gives me time to do the things I want uninterrupted and that includes thinking about things I want to think about. Being alone all the time is probably not very good for the brain because we crave connection but every now and then I think it's a good way to reset and relax.
I think it's good because you can reflect on yourself and discover things you didnt know before. it also drains out a bunch of noise.
For me it is a positive experience. I like to have that time alone to reset, enjoy the quiet, and charge my batteries so to speak. I need quiet time where I am not thinking or fronting for anybody.

I think time alone is mostly a positive experience. There are a lot of times when I am alone, and for the most part, I am content with being alone. It gives me time to think deeper about my life and things without being interrupted. There are very rare instances in which I feel lonely and hope someone could come keep me company. There are far more times when I am happy being by myself.

I like being alone.  I have lived alone for 16 years with my cat. This is a positive thing for me because I really don't socialize, I'm not a social butterfly. I enjoy being by myself. I don't have to answer or explain myself to anyone. i don't have to get acceptance to do anything I can do it or not do it, the choice is mine alone.  I am independent since being alone. I have figured out on my own how to do things that normally a man would do.  That makes me feel good.
I love being alone. I get overstimulated very easily. Gives me time to refresh my brain.

I find spending time alone to be positive, helpful, and rewarding. I think spending time alone provides an opportunity for introspection and reflection. It is also important to differentiate between spending time alone and feeling lonely. Feeling lonely can often feel negative and unpleasant, but for me, spending time alone is always a positive experience.

I think spending time alone can be a positive experience. It gives you a chance to get in touch with your feelings and gives you a chance to get a perspective on the important things in life. Spending too much time alone can also be negative so one must find a healthy balance.

I am an introvert, so my favorite thing to do is to be alone. I love being free to do whatever I like without having to worry about pleasing anyone else. I never get lonely, and I seem to need several hours of alone time each day. It's not that I don't enjoy my family and friends, but spending time with them uses up my energy, so I have to recharge after being social. I thrived during the pandemic because I loved being able to stay home and not feel obligated to go to social engagements. I have always considered being alone to be a very positive experience. I can think and daydream to my heart's content.

I think spending time alone can be both positive and negative for me, depending on the circumstances.

On the one hand, I enjoy having time to myself to relax and recharge. I can do whatever I want without having to worry about anyone else's needs or expectations. I can also use this time to reflect on my thoughts and feelings, and to work on my personal growth.

On the other hand, I can also feel lonely and isolated when I spend too much time alone. I miss the company of others, and I can start to feel down about myself. If I'm feeling stressed or anxious, being alone can make it worse.

Overall, I think it's important to find a balance between spending time alone and spending time with others. I need some time to myself to recharge, but I also need to connect with others on a regular basis.

Being alone is peaceful and I can get stuff done, either fun stuff or stuff that needs doing for my volunteer or paying jobs. Being physically alone doesn't mean not being connected to others. I can talk to people via phone or the internet whenever I want, either interactively or by sending messages and waiting for a reply. Sometimes it is nice to get together with other people in person though.
spending time alone is very positive. It's relaxing and provides for time where you don't have to worry about anyone else.

I usually try to be productive if I need to be alone, as I try to limit districtations and check off the various things I need to do. Still, I eventually get very bored and end up longing for stuff to do with friends and family. It really eats away at me.

I personally like to be alone with my thoughts, sometimes you really get to enjoy the beauty of your surroundings when you are along with only you. Nothing to distract you. Doing this for too long can be negative, but an ample amount of time alone is overwhelmingly positive in my opinion.

I get overwhelmed by too much sensory stimulation, and being around people is very exhausting to me. I fully enjoy spending as much time on my own as I can, so I can be alone with my thoughts. I spent a lot of time in isolation as a child, so it's just familiar to me.

It can be either positive or negative. Everybody needs at least some time alone, but too much time alone can become problematic. Being alone allows you time for your thoughts and to do whatever you want without having to worry about others. But too much time alone is problematic as people need human interaction.

Time to yourself isn't a bad thing. It gives us time to do things we wouldn't nomaly do with others like read or nap. Getting chores done. All types of things. It relaxing. It helps us appreciate the time spent with others. It can be good to have some time to yourself.

Being alone at times can be a positive experience. It allows me to recharge without any expectation or responsibility to anyone else. I gives me a sense of freedom that being with others doesn't. However, there are certainly times being alone is not pleasurable such as when I want to share an experience with people. Traveling and going out to eat is much more fun when you are not alone. Socializing, such as attending a party or having a drink is much more enjoyable with people. Non social activities like working benefits from being alone since you have no distractions. So there are positives and negatives to being alone and it is helpful to have alone time on occasion.

I have spent the majority of my time alive alone. This is not for lack of company or potential social interaction. The simple truth is that I find myself to be my best version when I am alone. There is a certain tranquility that one can obtain through being alone that one simply can not with a group. Although I deeply love my mother, my best friends and I love traveling. I find myself unwilling to abandon the safety of seclusion in my room and house. There have only been a few times in my life where I've wished for a more active life. Arguably I had a much much more active life prior to age 5 than I have in the intervening 24 years since. This was due to my mother being very extroverted and active herself. I do not miss or desire to return to that state of living.
Spending time alone is freeing because there isn't any judgment by watchful eyes and it is peaceful. However, it is very disconnected and solitude is brought on by avoidant behavior.
I like spending time alone with myself because it allows me to actually think. It also lets me breath and just take some time to enjoy peace.
I think being alone is positive because it can give you time to think about things, and to reflect.

Sometimes, being alone is regenerative. I can put my mind back together. Without needing to focus on other people and maintaining their wellbeing, I'm able to focus on my own a little more than normal. This can be helpful for me when I am so self sacrificing. 

Other times, it's not so good, that is if its too much, because I'm extraverted where I need to be around people to feel sane.

I would say that I spend a decent deal of time alone. I do not think that being alone is a bad thing. Every person needs their alone time for various reasons. It allows us to pursue our own interests, practice our hobbies, and just enjoy the solitude and the only thoughts that we have to keep in mind are our own.
To me spending time alone is a negative experience. When I am alone, I am alone in my own thoughts. And my thoughts can be quite negative.

I love to be alone. To me it is a very positive experience. You get to sit with your thoughts and find ways to entertain yourself. I also appreciate the time I spend with people more after having alone time. It is great for decompressing.
I think it’s good for the brain and helps you get a peace of mind and understand yourself more when you sit alone and think

To me being alone is preferable, most of the time than being with people.  I enjoy a quick visit here and there, but being alone for me is peaceful and in a way liberating, because I can act and do things the way I want to in private without having my constant built in "social acceptability" monitor my actions/words etc.  Not that this is a bad thing, since I am a strong believer of treating others with respect and kindness always and to the best of my ability.

I just find being alone to be more enjoyable than being in company of others.  It's nearly all positive for me.
I find it refreshing to have time alone. It gives me time to unwind and re-coup from social situations.

I think for the most part spending time alone is positive. I can think to myself, reflect, or do personal chores without any thought. There have been times however, when I have felt lonely or depressed and being alone exacerbated that feeling.
It is positive for me.  I get time to think about what is important to me without being interrupted

Sometimes I feel I am too crowded by people and get irritated. I woluld just prefer to be alone sometimes. If I'm at the library, I prefer to work on the computers alone, I don't like how distracting other peoples noises can be. When you isolate though, it can be unhealthy. Not having any social contact leaves you in not a good place mentally.

Being alone, in other words, existing in a state of solitude for stretches of time is an integral part of the reflection process. Self-reflection is an important part of being able to figure out how to exist in the world and sort through the myriad distractions with which one is faced. Without these periods of self-reflection, it is sometimes hard to fathom what one is going through, from interacting with other people, to handling financial matters, to planning one's present and future and looking back on one's past. The world is becoming more and more complex. Without private time to reflect on these issues, one is always in a mode of just reacting to phenomena around one, which is not really the way to go. I sometimes wonder why, especially in the modern world, people find it so hard to be alone for long stretches of time. It's almost as if they thought of being by oneself produces an allergic reaction in some people--an allergic reaction to themselves and their own mental processes. Increasingly, in schools, students are not being taught to ponder...

I think being alone sometimes is a healthy thing but not being alone for too long or all the time. I like to spend time alone sometimes and I find it to be positive because I enjoy some privacy and some peace. I can do what I want and not worry about what other people think and I can also not have to worry about what other people are doing and not be distracted. I find it enjoyable for awhile but in time I can get lonely and want to spend time with other people. I think it is normal to want to spend time alone at times but also have times when being with other people is desired.

I believe spending time alone to be mostly an enjoyable experience for me as I am a musician. Much of my time spent alone will be spent producing music. Outside of that, I enjoy the peace of having a space to reflect introspectively while also being able to tune out distractions caused by others. I also feel my best ideas for music happen when I'm alone. To some degree, however, loneliness does set in - and if I get too sucked into alone time, I tend to fall out of touch with friends/family. Additionally, I can be my worst enemy sometimes and get stuck in my head ruminating on unnecessary self-criticisms. Therefore, I do my best to socialize when feelings of loneliness/criticism arise to help me get out of my head.
I think it's positive, I have time to reflect.  Also, I get to plan my goals and self assess how well or poorly it's going.

I love being alone because I can do what I want to without having to compromise.  I can eat what I want, watch what I want on tv and do things on my own time table without having to consider someone else.  It's a peaceful experience for me because I generally work in jobs that require me to work in a team and around alot of people.

It can be a good experience that allows you to pursue hobbies and passions with your unlimited time. However it quickly becomes a negative experience as not having anyone to share any experience with caused a large toll on you over time.

Being alone gives me time to disengage from the stimulus of social interaction. This is beneficial as it allows me more time to think things out and make more logical decisions. It also allows me time to reflect upon events that have happened, whether my actions or emotions during these events played out how I wanted them to, and how I may learn from them. Often being in the company of others does not allow me time to weight my decisions.

I think it is a positive thing as I do not really enjoy dealing with people. Time alone gives me the time and focus for the things I want to do and the things I want to plan on. It allows me to focus on me without concern of anyone or anything else.

I absolutely love being alone. I can do what I want, whether its nap, read, watch television, anything. I always need time to recharge and it is very important to my mental health to have some alone time. I love my significant other and daughter, who live with me, but it can be overwhelming to me. I need that time to help stay focused and happy.
I think spending time alone can be a positive experience because it gives me time to pursue my own hobbies.  I get to enjoy my time doing things that I love.

To me depends on how much time you spending alone. I live with my partner who generally works out of home. Where myself, I work from home. I like when he's working as I'm able to work without any bother. However, with his current work being seasonal and changes, there are days when he's around more and it throws my routine off. I also like moments when I'm alone because I can sit down and watch TV in our living room since it's not hogging it for his console gaming needs. For me, it's definitely a positive for reasons like that.

it can rejuvenate you and balance your emotions and can be relaxing helps improve my well-being and improve my relationship toward others. Helps me clear my mind when if I'm going through a situation. spending time to heal.

I use my alone time to cope with the extensive amount of things I experience in a day. It serves as a way to process everything I experienced and really understand myself in the context of each moment. Some people may not need this to still have a good time with others but I feel like there's a balance for me that I need to keep otherwise I will have difficulty being present when people are around me and then niether of us will have a good time. It has been a mostly positive experience across my life because a lot of my hobbies don't always require other people and over time I got really good at finding interesting things to do by myself.

I am introverted. I like spending time alone because it helps me recharge. I like being able to do things without being judged. For example, I can sit and read manga comics or play video games. I like observing nature and thinking about life. Overall, i see being alone as a positive thing for me. I can't do this 100% of the time but if it's 75%, then I am happy. I do not feel lonely with that amount.

Being alone is a positive experience because I feel like I can be at peace. I can let my mind wander. I can do anything that I want to do. Being with others is mostly annoying and obligatory to the point where I don't want to do it. I can act how I want while recharging for the next social interaction.

I enjoy solitude. It is peaceful and there are no demands placed on me by other people. I like to think and passing the time by myself gives me time to do this without interruption. Spending time with other people often requires effort, because people either want or expect something of the person they are with. If people were more accepting and just allowed everyone to be themselves, without expectations, this wouldn't be the case. Even if that were so, I'd still like my alone time. I'm an introvert and this is comforting at times. Extraverts are often needy, needing attention and draining energy from others.

I think it depends for me. If I have regular intervals of alone time back to back to back it becomes a negative experience and fall into my depressive state. If I am alone one day a week, I can enjoy that time away from others and/or the grind to recoup. I have a line of how much alone time is good/bad

I think that spending time alone is a positive experience for men due to the fact that I grew up and still do live with a large family, and as of now, hold a lot of responsibility towards the younger members of the family. As such, whenever I find the time to spend it alone with no one else to bother me is time that I use to destress from everything, including the family, to ensure that I don't take it out on them.

Being alone at times is a universal part of life, experienced by nearly everyone. Yet, perspectives on solitude can differ greatly.

For me, solitude brings a sense of positivity to my life. It offers a chance to pause, reflect, and dive into my interests. In these moments, I connect with myself again, and gain a deeper understanding with who I really am. It's not about loneliness; it's about embracing the calm and quiet, as well as finding joy within. Time alone is an opportunity to nurture personal growth and self-awareness. It can be either a detriment or advantage to our life depending on how we like to use this time. I try to use alone time to my advantage as much as possible.
I think that I need a little bit of time alone, but when it's too long I start to get really low. And I tend to choose activities that are depressing/lazy.

Being alone can be a positive experience when you need time away from certain people or certain feelings. It allows for you to become more in-tune with yourself and with your feelings. It can be a negative experience when you feel super lonely and there might be things you want to share with someone or do with someone that you cannot, because there is no one around you.

I find that spending time alone is generally not a good thing, as I've personally noticed an increase in my overall happiness by being around others, even if it's only my family. I find it overall boring and lonely, and I find that my time is better spent by keeping up with my relationships with others, including friends. I'd also find it pretty lame to want to have a conversation about my day with others, only to find that nobody's around. That does happen sometimes and it's never fun.

While I do find it to be a bad experience to be alone, it does come with advantages sometimes. The biggest advantage I would contribute to this is that you can do things that you normally wouldn't be able to do with others easily, such as getting chores done easier, taking online courses, participating in research studies and just taking time to reflect on things.

I really enjoy spending time along. I have to be around people all. day. long. in my job. I have to share an office space. I dont have a room to myself. I have to be around customers and clients all of the time. So having some sense of alone and quiet time and actually very enjoyable and nice for me. I like to experience it and it gives me time to clear my head. It is not lonely for me at all. It gives me time for peace, quiet, and time to do things I enjoy by myself like reading or listening to music. I do enjoy doing things with my husband or friends or family too. But I think alone time is healthy. We need to rely on ourselves now and then.

I think spending time alone is positive because you get to recharge and be alone with your thoughts. Being alone with your thoughts allows you to grow and think of ways you could have been better. Being alone is relaxing especially after a long day at work.

It can be both a positive and negative experience. I have been divorced for 7 years now. The negative aspect of it is when I come home it is too quiet. I miss my daughter`s laughter, while the positive is I get to know the real me and do a lot of deep thinking. Also, I have developed many new skills like writing an e-book and creating t-shirts, but in the end, I rather have a family.
I love being alone. It's a way for me to recharge and not think about how I need to act around anyone else. It's my favorite.

I'm fine with it.   I generally like it.  And don't get me wrong, I don't necessarily want to go live like a hermit on the top of a mountain, but I do like my "me" time.   And sure, humans are social creatures.   We're practically herd animals.   But I also appreciate being able to do my own thing.   Togetherness is great, but there is such a thing as too much of a good thing.   So, in a nutshell, I think alone time, in moderation, is wonderful.

Spending time alone is something we all do, but our feelings about it differ. Some of us enjoy the peace, finding it positive and fulfilling, while others might feel lonely, seeing it as a negative experience. In this study, they're curious about my view on being alone. How much do I enjoy it, and why? It's interesting to think about how these moments affect me

To me, it really depends on the reason I'm alone for it to be positive or negative. It's positive when I'm not truly "alone," this is, when I know I can have companionship I like close by. By contrast, it's negative when I am truly alone, with no one reaching out nor caring about me.

I think that being alone is a very good thing. You learn who you are without the influence of others. If you are comfortable being alone, you will never settle for another's company who you wouldn't otherwise want to be around. Being alone gives you a sense of independence which is a very positive thing.

time alone provides an opportunity for introspection and self-discovery. It allows me to unwind, recharge, and engage in activities that I find personally fulfilling. During these moments, I can focus on hobbies, interests, and creative pursuits without any distractions. This can foster a sense of serenity and peace, creating a space for personal growth and mindfulness. I often find that spending time alone lets me clear my mind, reflect on my thoughts and emotions, and gain a deeper understanding of myself. It's during these moments that I can truly connect with my inner thoughts and feelings without the influence of external factors.
Spending tie alone is relaxing, and can be an excellent way to destress. However, spending too much time alone can lead to loneliness, which is not healthy.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me. It is a way to center myself and feel connected to my own feelings. I am an introvert and it's easy for me to get overwhelmed by other people's opinions and emotions. I am only truly at peace when I am alone.

I used to be an extroverted person. I would spend most of my time with other people or at least seeking other people to hang out with. This led to a lot of disappointment. After enough of that I decided to work on enjoying myself more by myself or just my family. I have largely been a hermit for the past 20 years or so. It has gotten to the point where I no longer miss being the center of attention.

Being alone is both good and bad for me. It feels good to be alone for awhile, because I'm shy and somewhat social anxious. But if I am with a group of friends, I feel comfortable and usually enjoy my time. Being alone sometimes allows me to think in peace and quiet, but sometimes I start to feel lonely and like I'm missing out on life.

I think being alone can be positive if you're introverted and spend a majority of time around people while working or doing other daily activities. Introverts(myself included), have a hard time being around a lot of people for an extended period of time and it benefits them to spend time alone. Other people can benefit as well if they need time to think about decisions or recent events.

Spending time alone is a very positive experience. I find solace and comfort in my own company, and being alone allows me to immerse myself in my thoughts and reflections. During these moments of solitude, I can truly be myself, without any external influences or distractions.

I value the opportunity to engage in activities I love without pressure or judgment from others. This may include reading a book, pursuing a hobby, or relaxing. Being alone enables me to focus on what brings me joy. This undistracted time also lets me explore my interests.

Being alone offers a sense of freedom. I can set my own pace and create my own routine without compromising or accommodating others. This autonomy is empowering and helps me maintain a healthy sense of independence.

Additionally, spending time alone allows me to cultivate a sense of mindfulness. I can engage with my thoughts and emotions without the noise of social interactions. This introspection helps me better understand myself and my feelings, leading to increased self-awareness and emotional well-being.

Ultimately, the positive experience of being alone is all about self-care. It's about giving myself the space and time to recharge my energy, nurture my passions, and nurture my mental and emotional health. I don't much appreciate social interactions and the company of others. It's far too draining and I feel like I'm masking, so I'd rather simply be myself, alone.

I have been living on my own for going on two years now. After a bad fallout from a romantic relationship, having a place of my own has helped me in my path of self improvement. It led me to face some of the internal struggles I was avoiding with myself pre-pandemic and try to be a better person. At first, the feeling of being alone was strange and caused some anxiety, however this isn't to say I don't have social interactions almost daily (i.e. the gym, outings with friends, neighbors, etc.). Now, I have found being alone allows me more time to decompress and work on hobbies/projects of mine. 

I also work remotely half of my work week, so my time in isolation is higher than the average.

Hummm. I remember a long time ago a person was talking about being alone in the world.
He said you must teach your kids how to be alone, for they may be that half or all of their lives.
For me its about half and half. you can't really get away from people. Its just set up that way. And human beings are social animals just like the rest of the animals on the planet.
I myself am alone, but not. I am an animal person and would rather be with at this point in life. As my feral cat comes walking in right now.

To be totally alone, most cannot handle it. And they snap. Society has been corrupted and I see the results of that.
I moved into the wilderness. But still, I have to deal with society and all its issues. Going totally mountain man would be rough, I suppose that keeps most in the circle of humanity.

Being alone is something that I look forward to and enjoy.  It allows me to slow down, consider my personal needs and how I am feeling, and also gives me the freedom to do what I need and want to do according to my timetable.  Being alone removes me from the stress of dealing with other people and their demands, negative attitudes, and allows me to reflect on "me" rather than focus on others.

Being alone is in itself neither positive or negative. Depending on the context, it can feel positive or negative. Being alone can give me the time and space to do activities I want to do, to be contemplative and creative, and to relax. On the other hand, being alone can feel lonely, distressing, and isolating.

It really comes down to how much of your time that you are spending alone and whether or not it's by choice. I normally enjoy spending large amounts of time alone to work on hobbies but when I feel the need for contact with others I go and hang out with friends. If I didn't have the option of going out and interacting with people when I needed it things would become lonely, depressing, and have a very negative impact on my work and social life.

I like spending time alone as i live alone out in the country. The nearest store to me is a 30 minute drive away. When i am alone i don't have to please anyone else or answer to anybody. I find it satisfying to keep myself entertained.

Most of the time I have no problem being alone since I tend to do things by myself in my own time anyway. I call this "me time". I tend to do some prolific studies, play video games, keep up on my credit, check emails and so on. However at some points I will find myself bored or finished with what I'm currently doing and start feeling lonely. Almost as if something is missing to fill in the hole that is currently there.
I think it's healthy to spend some time alone.

I think spending time alone has both good and bad side. For me spending time alone depends on my mood. Sometimes I really like spending time alone as I get to think more about myself and how I can improve my lifestyle. I feel most motivated when spend time alone. And sometimes I get more productive and hyperactive when I do things in my alone time. So spending time alone gives me inner peace and satisfaction, But I also enjoy company because sometimes I feel that I need to be with someone, I also have the urge to interact with my people. For example I like to spend time with my partner, friends and family and participate in social activities. From my point of view spending time alone have made me feel both positive and negative experience.

I think spending time alone can be both a positive or negative experience depending on the day and what I'm currently going through. I enjoy being alone after socializing for a long time but I feel lonely being alone when I haven't been around friends in awhile.

I don't think being alone is necessarily positive or negative. It depends on the person, the situation, etc. In general, its likely unhealthy to spend all of one's time alone or all of one's time around others. I personally enjoy some time alone and some time with others. I assume just about every other person in existence feels the same way, with some variety in terms of time spent with each.
As a parent of young children, it's been very difficult to get some lone time.  So I fully cherish the lone I get to unwind and treat myself.

I am very introverted and I enjoy time alone more than a lot of people.  I actually need it to recharge and reflect or I get very anxious and overwhelmed if I have to spend too much time around other people.  I can usually find something to keep myself occupied and don't feel bored or lonely very often.

Spending time alone provides an opportunity for self-reflection and introspection, aiding in better understanding one's thoughts, emotions, and desires. It encourages creativity by allowing uninterrupted exploration of interests and hobbies. Solitude fosters self-reliance and problem-solving skills, contributing to personal growth and resilience. It also offers a break from societal pressures and distractions, enabling individuals to recharge and establish a stronger sense of identity. Overall, solitude facilitates a deeper connection with oneself, leading to enhanced well-being and a more balanced life perspective.
Needing alone time every once and awhile is normal, but it's when I feel isolated that it's a problem. If I go more than a day without talking with friends or family, I get very sad.

I generally find being alone to be a positive thing. As a generally introverted person, I find I need time alone to recharge very often. I like to be alone to gather my thoughts and feelings about my life or day in general. I also enjoy solitary activities like reading and writing.

I have personally always enjoyed my time alone. I enjoy being alone too read a good books, watch my favorite TV shows or movies, exercise alone, or just relax and do absolutely nothing. I do feel time alone is healthy for everyone, but too much time alone is isolating and can be unhealthy.

Being alone is nearly always a positive experience for me. It brings me calmness, peace, and rest. If I don't have time alone I feel stressed, overstimulated, and mentally worn out, but having time alone is a reset for me that helps me re-energize. Being alone allows me to focus on tasks undistracted. I also have the opportunity to think more clearly and focus on making decisions. I'm able to get to know myself more and work on self-improvement rather than keeping myself busy and distracted.

I like being alone most of the time. I don't like a lot of people around me. I like to relax and enjoy my peace. I've always been this way. But I do go out and socialize with friends at least once or twice a week and then I'm fine.

I have and continue to think about being alone as a positive experience.  I am an introverted extrovert - I enjoy being around people, talking about various things, and learning about others' lives.  What is meaningful then, to me, afterward is to be by myself and think about these things and myself.  I find that when I'm with people for too long, I start to not appreciate it anymore - that it become tedious and overwhelming and I feel like I lose myself.  Being alone helps me readjust, unwind, and take stock of how I'm feeling without extra stimuli.

Spending time alone, in moderation, is positive for me. It allows me to reflect on my emotions privately, process the events of the day, and be entirely myself. I don't need to compromise or make room for other people's opinions when I'm alone. However, if I spend too much time alone, I begin to feel lonely. I like spending time with people. I'm generally very outgoing. I cannot be alone too much or I begin to feel depressed.

To me being alone is a positive experience. I'm introverted so I gain energy from being away from people. This doesn't mean I dislike hanging out with people, but my "social battery" drains very quickly when around other people, especially unpleasant people or extremely high energy people. 
When I am alone, I can recharge and have time to do my favorite hobbies like reading and writing and playing video games. Then when my social battery has recharged, I want to talk to people and hang out with them again.

I enjoy spending time alone and lived most of my adult life alone. I’ve had relationships but none that lasted past about two years and only one where we lived together. When I took the Meyers-Briggs personality indicator I scored as an introvert, although not all that far from the center line dividing extrovert and introvert. As I explored this with a counselor, and by myself later, this reflects how I recharge rather than my lack of comfort with other people. I like people, I like being around them and I don’t consider myself shy or socially awkward. I also enjoy public speaking. But how I reset, recharge and restore myself is largely done alone, whether I’m out walking, camping alone or sitting and reading in a room away from other people. Before the pandemic I went out several times a week to a favorite bistro or pub and sat alone reading and people watching. To me that is still being alone, although not the same as being completely away from others, which I need to feel fully rested.
I have no problem spending time alone. I don't understand why others find it difficult to be alone. I do realize it can be unhealthy to isolate yourself. I use my time alone to get things done.

Spending time alone is a positive for me because while I love being around people, being alone gives me an opportunity to recharge and relax. I don't feel pressure to be doing something for someone else while I am alone.  Its truly my time for me.
I like to be alone.  In fact, I have to be alone a little bit each day to regroup, gather my thoughts, pray and unwind.  I don't always want to be alone, but it is a necessity sometimes.
Spending time alone is essential because I am an introvert, it allows me to collect my thoughts and enjoy a disturbance free atmosphere

For me, spending time alone is a very positive experience. I enjoy spending time daydreaming, processing, and reflecting my thoughts. Being alone gives me time to gain perspective on my past and to plan more intentionally for my future. Being alone removes the pressure of being around people, which at times can be stressful and draining both physically and emotionally.

I think being alone is a negative experience for me because I have struggled with mental health issues in the best. I often let my mind wander when I’m alone and fear where it may go. I no longer struggle with these issues fortunately but I do find myself trying to fill the silence when I am alone with music, tv, or podcasts to ensure my train of thought is positive.

How I feel about being alone depends on how I feel in the moment. Sometimes, it's a negative experience if I'm alone and I feel lonely and sad. I miss human connection if it's been a while since I've talked to someone, like 2 or 3 days. If I feel lonely I try to call someone on the phone, or I go to the mall to look around the shops. Most of the time I am fine alone, and its a positive experience. I play with my cat or watch tv. I like being alone sometimes so I can listen to music and just relax.

I have many hobbies that I can do at home (i.e. family history and quilting).  When I'm doing these hobbies the day goes by very fast.  I still love the time with family but when its my time I love to go to my room and do what I love.  My spouse has his hobbies as well so we always get together for our meals and after supper we spend the rest of the night together, it works well with us. We haven't fought for 30 years so it must be working
Being alone is peaceful. It is nice not to have anyone around. It is very positive.

I am asocial so alone is fantastic. Um, there is the whole introverted/too sensitive thing, where these types of people are supposed to need time by themselves to recharge. And, I am introverted and sensitive, but, mostly, I am just traumatized by life and all the relationships I have had and the career choices I have made over the course of my first 30 years of living. I made a conscious decision to just end all relationships and be done with that aspect of life. I wanted total independence of time and thought and tasks. I am entirely entertained by video games, the internet, artistic pursuits, and require no social interactions at all. It's been like this for the past 16 years. Technically, my elderly parents are living in the same house as me, but those interactions are extremely minimal. 

The only thing I miss is being desired and having lovers. But that stuff is for the young and perfectly youthful bodies. It's too embarrassing at this age. I still have a weirdly young looking face by my body can fuck right off. Forever. 

I've also worked from home since I was 25 years old, so there's that as well. I don't think I could work with people again if I tried. There is no world in which someone else will ever be my boss. Not at a job, nor as a husband. :)
Spending time alone is positive for me because I am an introvert and don't really enjoy being around a lot of people. Being in crowds is stressful, so being alone is nice and comforting.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me. I have a stressful job that requires me to be around people most of the time, so being able to be by myself is therapeutic. I can recharge and do whatever I want to do without worrying about anyone else. My alone time is what keeps me sane and allows me to do my job.

I think that being alone gives me time to get things accomplished like working on studies or getting things cleaned up around the house. I think that getting things accomplished is a positive thing. I like being able to feel like I've done things through out the day that need to get done like checking some items off my list. I enjoy checking items off my list.

the alone time wasencourages independence and helps build confidence in your ability to be alone, act alone, and find enjoyment alone. The solitude you find, whether it's physical or mental distance, lets you relax and relieve tension

For me, spending time alone is a very positive experience.  In my household, it's just myself and my husband, so I do have alot of time alone and I enjoy it very much.  I am a very independant person and I believe that is why I enjoy it so much.  I am perfectly comfortable just reading a book, watching tv, cleaning the house, doing whatever in perfect silence.

It's good to be in a meditative state once in a while to be mindful of ones self. That is easier in a quiet alone setting. It is a positive experience because it is quiet. It is also a good time to pray and to think about things to be grateful for.

I love being alone. AT the moment it's just a luxury, as I live with my daughter and her children. But soon enough I'll join the van life and be on my own again. I can't wait. I love being alone. I love the quiet. I love being with my own thoughts, my own emotions. Space to spread out and do the things I enjoy. Hike, enjoy nature, a nice fire... I enjoy my own company and value it very  much.

Spending time alone is like recharging your battery quickly. It is wonderful to share with others. However alone time is good to rest and prepare for all areas of your life. To catch up on reading and to catch up on chores. To run errands. Spending time alone makes you a better person to be with. Being alone raises your energy to share with others. So that they can enjoy you, so that you can help them. It is also a matter of good health hygiene.

I think spending time alone is a positive experience. I think that it is good for our minds to be able to spend time with ourselves. I think that if we can spend time alone, then we have a good sense of self.

Being alone is positive for me because it allows me to recharge my social battery.  While I enjoy the company of others who share my interests and are open-minded, I am not someone who needs constant companionship or 27/7 connection.

I like to have my alone time. I feel like I need it. I prefer it at night before bed and when I am driving. It gives me time with my own thoughts. To sort out the day or things I haven't had time to work out in my head. I can decompress without having to worry about someone else or having a conversation. I could not have to much alone time though. I would feel lonely and get to much into my own thoughts. I need to be around my loved ones throughout the day. Then decompress at night.

Being alone is a positive experience for me because it gives me the time focus on myself. There is no distraction for when I needed to reflect. I can really enjoy what I enjoy doing the most without having to worry of the other person I am spending time with.

For the most part spending time alone is healthy. It is a good time to relax, to take a mental break, to get something off my to-do list, to engage in self-care, to spend time on hobbies - there are a lot of positive things to do alone. It can also be peaceful, since I work with people a lot to have a break. Occasionally too much alone time can be isolating, especially if I wished other people reach out to me, but usually it's good.

I spent a great deal of my life in chaos and trauma. Being alone allows me freedom to heal. I can spend times examining my thoughts, good or bad, at my own pace and with calm. I also enjoy being able to choose my own times, what I watch, listen do, or where I go. There’s no expectations in alone time, only my own.

Being alone is a positive experience because you have time to decompress and get familiar with yourself without disruption from anyone else. You can learn how to navigate life individually and gain a sense of independence. Sometimes you can feel lonely, but being alone and being lonely are still two different things. Being lonely is a state of isolation that can come from within, regardless of who you are around or how long you've been in a certain setting. Being lonely while you're alone can be a debilitating experience because you don't have anything else counteracting the negative connotation of both ordinances. When you are especially in a long-term relationship, maintaining individuality and taking time for yourself is important. The same applies for living in a household of more than one person or just being actively social for extended periods of time. We all need time to reset and discover how we are impacted by all sensations.

In my opinion, spending time alone is a positive experience overall, however, it could be a negative experience at some times. I enjoy spending time alone, I feel I can get more things done because I have less distractions. Sometimes you are just having one of those days and want to lay around and watch TV without having to entertain someone. On the other hand, when your feeling sad, lonely, and depressed, being alone can be harmful because you have time to just sit and dwell and negative thoughts consume you. Having a friend around, or someone close to you can steer you away from those thoughts and hopefully cheer you up.

It's positive for me because I enjoy my time alone. I find that when I'm by myself, I'm able to relax more and take things more easily as they come. I like sharing time with other people, too, but I think everyone needs a good bit of time by themselves.

Being alone and how well a person likes it depends much on their lifestyle. I live alone so I'm by myself so much more than someone living with other people. In that context, I'm much more likely to experience loneliness. On the other hand, a person can live/be with other people and experience extreme loneliness anyway. Overall, being by myself and whether or not I feel lonely depends on my mindset at the time. Sometimes it's terrible, other times it's peacefully wonderful.
I very much enjoy being alone. Not that I don't like people, but I just don't need much companionship. I always say that I can entertain myself.
I like being alone. I find it exhausting to be around other people, even people I am close to. I find myself looking forward to going back to being by myself when I am around others.

Spending time alone is mostly a negative experience for me. I like to be around people. Spending time alone makes me feel lonely. But there can be time when I would need some space and like to spend time alone.

As an introverted 34-year-old mother of two and a wife, spending time alone provides you with a cherished opportunity to recharge and find inner peace. Amid the demands of family life, solitude offers a chance to rejuvenate your energy and refocus your thoughts. It allows you to engage in activities that align with your personal interests, fostering a sense of self-identity beyond your roles as a mother and wife. This solo time provides the mental space to reflect, introspect, and nurture your emotional well-being. Ultimately, it empowers you to better engage with your family and relationships, enriching your overall life experience.

Overall, being alone for an extended period of time is not great, but if done in moderation, I find it peaceful and relaxing. It allows me to focus and concentrate better on whatever task I am doing. Being alone also eliminated distraction, which is much needed in my life. I cherish the time I have when I get some alone time. However, it can be like a double edge sword because being alone too long, really causes you to be mentally detached from others which is not ideal for mental health.
I think being alone is a positive experience because it allows me to recharge and feel more peaceful/relaxed.
Spending time alone for me is something positive. I find it as a way to unwind and relax without hearing anyone. I always have positive experiences spending time alone.
I like to read so being alone means I can read without being interrupted. I also like the quietness. However I wouldn't want to be alone all the time.

Being alone is a highly positive experience for me. It is when I am most able to fully relax. It is when I feel most free to do my own thing and live my life as I wish. Being alone allows for introspection and peacefulness. I feel more energized after being alone for a while.

I get easily stressed from too much social time. Being by myself allows me to rest and recharge. I am able to focus of goals and hobbies when I have more time alone. I feel like this improves my mental health and allows me to reflect on what is most important in my life.

I spend quite a bit of time alone and find it a positive experience. I'm never bored because I have many interests and am a curious person. When not working on a project, I occupy my time reading, writing, listening to music while I do other things, doing chores, preparing meals, keeping up with the news, communicating with friends or family or business associates, researching one thing or another, and just basically keeping my brain and body engaged. Being alone is very rarely a negative experience for me, and except for a few times during isolation due to Covid, I've rarely felt lonely or in need of human company. Having a cat helps with companionship.

Spending time alone is a matter of perspective. For some, it can be miserable. For me, it can be used as an opportunity to reflect, learn and work on my goals or hobbies. For the most part, it is positive for me.
I think for myself, spending time alone, I enjoy. Years ago, I did not like spending time alone but as I have gotten older, I enjoy it, I relax.
I dont choose to be alone, it's just the way it is so I try to be as positive as i can about it. I get very lonely and it is hard but I try to see the best in it.
To me spending time alone in moderation is a good thing. Sometimes you just need to be with your own thoughts and God.

I don't mind spending time alone and actually enjoy it. I am at a point where I am fine socializing with other people, but it was not always that way. I always felt a bit different and found it hard to make connections. On top of that, I felt extremely mentally drained after any type of socializing. When I am alone, I can be myself, and enjoy my own company. There is no pressure.

I think because I'm an introvert, spending time alone is me time. A time for me to recharge after the day. It allows me to think and reflect on the day and what had happened for me that day. It's sort of like a way for me to hang out with me. I also like not having to think too much about others. I tend to think too much about others. Like if this other person I am hanging out with is having fun, if they want to go there, if they want to eat this, etc. It's mentally stressful to always be thinking about others so when I'm alone, I only have myself to think for.
It is positive because growing up I never had friends. I am used to being alone and doing things on my own. I have no trouble being alone. So I am fine with it.
I love being alone with myself. I can do as I please and if I leave a drawer open, it remains open until I close it again. I have the freedom to do whatever I want.

Spending time alone is a positive experience for me. It is a time of peace and calm. A time to unwind and do the things I want to do. I also have 5 kids so that makes alone time more enjoyable after a long day. However, alone time after too long can get boring and lonely. I usually long for some human interaction after a day of being alone.
I think taking time alone is a positive thing. Because without taking time alone, you'll never have time to yourself.
I think spending time alone can be a good thing cause you think clearer but not fo long. Being alone can be really bad and you lose a sense of your self and how you interact with others.

I need to be alone for long periods of time. Being with people is exhausting to me because I pick up their energy. I am revitalized by being alone. I enjoy doing things that require me to be alone, like reading, painting and writing. I like being with myself and enjoy my own company.

I think spending time alone is mostly a positive thing. It allows me to better understand myself and gather my thoughts. It allows me to avoid stress and recharge my social battery. I also like that I have time to invest in my own activities and do not rely on others to accomplish things I want to do.
Spending time alone is a very positive experience for me. I collect my thoughts and think about the future
its a mostly indifferent experience for me , so long as it doesn't drag on for days on end.Very well aware of triggers that start a depressive spiral and that is usually one of them.

Being alone is a positive experience for me because I generally don't like interacting with people on a daily basis. I am able to be alone with my thoughts. My alone time is very important to me. Being alone lets me express myself in ways that I usually can't around other people. I like being alone because lots of things often bother me to the point that I get angry.

I don't mind being by myself most of the time.  I can be hard to live with if there is always someone else trying to get me to do something with them.  Overall, it's a positive, but there are certainly times when being alone gets tiresome.  Sometimes, I want to have someone else to plan and enjoy life with in my life.

Being alone is a very positive experience for me. I'm autistic and get very easily overwhelmed in social settings so being alone for portions of the day is necessary for me to reset and feel at peace. Being alone allows me to connect with myself in a way that's not possible when you're around someone else. You're always at least a little bit worried and/or aware of the other person and it's hard to focus on yourself.

Spending time alone is positive for me. When I am alone it gives me an opportunity to reflect on my thoughts and decision-making, as well as it helps me build a healthy relationship with myself instead of relying on or wanting to be around others.

I've been alone for years and it's depressing. The only people I ever really talk to are family and I see them sometimes but it's not the same. I don't mind being alone on occasion but everyday for years takes it toll. Being alone sometimes to gather your thoughts is great but everyday is not great.

I've always enjoyed spending time alone and all of my hobbies are solitary activities. Living in sober houses and rehabs have given me a sort of self consciousness about that, so that I think I'm isolating and that's an unhealthy behavior sometimes.
